My wife's turkey burger was good too and I usually hate turkey burgers.. They have an amazing beer selection...I actually got a Four Peaks Hop Knot and I wasn't at Papago or Four Peaks... I was really pleasantly surprised and recommend this place highly... I can only imagine after a night of drinking how a burger would taste at one in the morning!

AiYppc3xtQ5F_tNy_4fY1A.text: I would give it a three, but the price just kills it.    I've been there twice and each time was a minor disappointment.  I got the turkey burger, fiance got a chicken sandwich, and we split a "basket" of sweet potato fries. Their "basket" is extremely small - even if served in a mini shopping cart.  The turkey burger falls apart easily and is sort of dry.  The killer here is the price.  This meal comes to $30 with tip.  That is pretty hefty cost for a burger and splitting a medium order of fries.  They do have a nice beer list and the cupcakes that are made next door and served as a dessert here are delicious but this doesn't outweigh the high cost, low amount fries, and the awful conversations you have to put up with (this is a personal view, and why I don't live in scottsdale).  I'd recommend checking out Soma Cafe for a better burger + sweet potato fries.

ms-jJDEczlxen1Ve6wC5lQ.text: Woah woah woah.  There are MUCH better burgers in the world!   I came here on the recommendation of a cab driver (don't mess with cabbies they know everything about a city) who said that he thought Delux had the best burger in the Phoenix area.  While this may be True since I did not get to try any other burgers while in Phoenix, I highly doubt that this is THE BEST in the Phoenix area ... I simply refuse to believe it.  The food wasn't bad.  It just wasn't great.  The only saving grace of Delux is that they had a really expansive and interesting selection of beers both on tap and in the bottle.  If I lived in Phoenix though, I probably wouldn't go back.

30gl7q3uUrXph410mEBU7g.text: AWESOME! I would elaborate further but I'm mowing down a killer Delux burger..... yum!

Mr65Wd_zrgQY16y3uqmjkw.text: Excellent!  Sometimes a little noisy.  Sometimes a wait.   I pretty much always get a lettuce wrap cheeseburger, their bread is too big AND sweet potato fries!  I love how the fries come out in little shopping carts.    It was the first restaurant I had been too after living in NYC that reminded me of NYC!  That was one of reasons we kept going back.  And now they have cupcakes too!  Or just head across the street for gelato!

SJvF_HKrq29XLs5FT8ex9w.text: I'm sure I don't have to mention that they have the best sweet potato fries around, but just in case you didn't know, I'm telling you now, THEY HAVE THE BEST SWEET POTATO FRIES AROUND!!!  My first visit to Delux, back when I was a carnivore, was suggested by a friend after a night at the club ended way too early (no comment), and Denny's was not an option. I ordered a burger and a side of sweet potato fries because I'd never tried them before, and now I make sure those are the only fries I ever eat.  This last week I took my boyfriend there because he'd never wandered past his Gilbert bubble and since there really wasn't anything we could eat that had no meat (I know, vegetarian in a burger place, but I only wanted the fries) we ordered a cheese panini and a large order of mixed fries. My bf couldn't gobble them up fast enough. I knew I should have ordered two =(

x3JpRockOMbOmzgbAWzaUw.text: After slamming Scottsdale's Roaring Fork for their dry-as-hell Big Ass Burger, I felt it was only right I let those in the greater Phoenix area know who has a real burger.  Delux has a real burger.  Granted it is not on as many "Top Ten" lists as the Big Ass Burger, but how often are those things right, anyway?  I suspect those reviews are too often written by journalistic whores who make underhanded deals with restaurant owners, trading free meals on their knees and two-night-a-week access to the bottom shelf in exchange for plugging a restaurant's mediocre fare.  Luckily my fellow yelpers are much smarter than that. How much smarter?  Much smarter enough to trust a random stranger who utilizes a terrifying picture of Conrad Veidt as his personal icon and writes food reviews at 2:00 in the morning.  Damn straight!  Now, on to the food!  I have been going to Delux burger for about nine years, and the menu has grown vastly in that time.  However, I don't often stray from getting the Classic Burger.  It is always cooked great, and medium-rare means you are going to get your burger medium rare.  Full of flavor and just damn delightful.  It's like a flavor explosion in your mouth.  You know that Deftones' song, "Passenger"?  It's like that - but in your mouth.  If you aren't familiar with the song, trust me when I tell you this is a very good thing.  And I don't even really like the Deftones.  Or Tool.  I would also recommend the Delux Burger, the namesake, the flagship, the Big Kahuna, the Keyser Soze, the mysterious golden-light-coming-out-of-the-briefcase.  Okay, so it's not as good as all that, but it is pretty tasty.  For the Los Angelenos out there, the Delux Burger is a direct rip-off of the Father's Office Office burger (Santa Monica), complete with the baby arugula.  The difference?  Delux is less cocksure and will let you have all the ketchup you want.  Boo-ya, Father's Office.  Boo-ya.  I have never had a bad burger at this place.  The food is consistently exceptional.  My ex-girlfriend introduced me to Delux, so I cry a little bit every time, but the bittersweet, nostalgic ache in my heart is quickly soothed by the delicious red meat, grilled onions, and toasted bun I stuff in my mouth.  Despite the emotional baggage waiting for me whenever I arrive, I can still recognize it is a good place for a date.  My half-Japanese girl (who does it to me every time) really likes the sushi, and they give you as much hot water as you request to squeeze every last drop of life out of your bag of green tea.  If you are looking for a good burger, look no further than Delux.  Tell them Tommy sent you, and they will look at you blankly and nothing will happen.  You won't regret it.  Any of it.

q-Nv8FIvt6n5OFnErOEJpQ.text: You have to experience DELUX.  The food is a combination of sushi and hamburgers. I had a seaweed salad and a Classic Burger. The video makes you feel like you are watching a giant aquarium and then oops-a shark shows up just for the thrill of it. Wanted a 1/2 order of fries-no problem.  They customize everything on the menu for you, if you want, and make a point to offer "protein style".  Love the vibe and the atmosphere.  The food is delicious!

vHvfMF8Wf0zUkwRFbKHNRg.text: It was my first time here on a Saturday. I was beyond impressed. Everything was modern and the staff were polite. The whole place was elegant yet had an illusion; it looked like there's a huge mirror on the wall.. really it's the other side of the room. The food was great along with the ambience.

Wcgp5bhy8cWeZ67L9pnZ0Q.text: After researching numerous articles on the best burgers in Phoenix, it was noticed that Delux burger was on every one of those lists. I myself have been dying to try it for some time now and my bf happened to be having a burger craving last night. After some convincing, we went to Delux and for a small place, was so happy to be seated right away because it was 8pm and we were HUNGRY. The ambiance of the place is "bar and lounge" which to me was nice especially for a Friday night. However my bf wasn't initially pleased because of the dim lighting and the fact that he wouldn't be able to "see his food." Let's just say that didn't matter anymore because his first words after his first bite of the Delux burger was, "burger craving fulfilled!" ... And after trying it myself, I was impressed. Definitely one of the best burgers I've tried. I got the veggie burger which was good, but I wish I had ordered the Delux burger as well! We also got an order of mixed fries (regular & sweet potato) a la carte (literally, in a super cute tiny shopping cart!) and was very pleased! My bf who also was not a sweet potato fan just became one because theirs were that good... And the aioli sauce it came with helped a ton!   Our server was more than attentive and we even got a visit and chat from who I believe was the owner which was very nice. We were curious to try the sushi that they recently started serving there, which the owner explained stems from his other restaurant, Zen 32.. But we will save that for next time because we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie burger, mixed fries a la carte (in a cart!), and the Delux burger

ni0YS_UV3yh2qbpuLXQgvg.text: I've been here a couple times. I love their fries, and I love their milkshakes the most. Of course the burgers are solid. They also do sushi and I still need to try that! The atmosphere at night is beautiful and low key. Great date night place for sure!  The best part is they're open until 2am! My friends and I were looking for some late night quality food and where else better than Delux :)

9Y8kYBVsMxj4JMgdS24LLw.text: First things first -- this is some great food they're slinging over here at Delux. No doubt about that. The wife had a Chinese chicken salad, and I rocked the slider "mini burger" duo. No complaints whatsoever about the food.   Prices on the other hand? Not so much. My slider duo was $11.75 and didn't come with fries. That was another $3 for a half order. $15 for two sliders and fries? Ouch. Her salad was $10, which at least was a very healthy portion of salad. I also ordered a draft root beer, which was also delicious. That ran $3.50, and no refills. Nearly $20 ($18.25) for a pair of sliders, fries, and a drink? That's not cool.   Don't get me wrong. I don't mind paying for quality. And the service is fantastic. I just think you're paying a little too much for the quality at Delux. Protip: Get the half order of fries at $3. It's more than enough.  I'd come back -- as the food is that good -- but keep in mind you're looking at almost $40 for two (with tip) for a burger joint.

C27lQKgoW5QCPDTbc_c5rw.text: Great place for sushi. The sushi is super fresh and very tasty. Dont be fooled by the way the restaurant looks, the quality of fish is top notch.  What's even more surprising is the sliders. One of the best in town and very juicy. This place is a hodgepodge of asian and american. It's confusing and awesome at same time.  They offer authentic asian sushi, but also serve one of the juiciest american sliders I've ever had. I have no idea how to categorize this restaurant, but you should just try it out. They have happy hour and reverse happy hour!  Great ambience for a date. Lenny the Owner is super nice too. He's at the restaurant usually ever night eating with the rest of us!

OZ56Q2EFRY0rkZeGVN_GuQ.text: My girl and I visit this place every time we fly in!! its a tradition! The fries and sweet potato fries come in a mini shopping cart basket and are bomb!!! Overall the food is great, the service is great, and the vide is chill! prices could be worked on... about a $1 or $2 above market prices for the same quality and style type restaurant. But a definite check out!

mWGl3UA3zB73BFjjkKiVUw.text: This place is tremendous! Oh my god! The burgers are amazing! The fries are amazing as well. Despite the cart of fries getting smaller the quality of the food is still there!!!

9CQ6fWTRBkPfhqAUlyJe0Q.text: I've eaten in and done take-out from here, always a burger and fries. The burgers are fantastic and both the regular and sweet potato fries are delicious. Order a basket (or 1/2 basket) of mixed if you can't decide. The low rating is the result of two poor customer service experiences, both at the take-out counter.   Take-out is on the sushi side where you can call in or order at the register. While looking at the menu and asking questions about bun/cheese options, the gal at the register's attention was divided between me and a fellow co-worker (it may have been the owner). While she answered my questions, she wasn't particularly pleasant and I left feeling as though asking questions about their menu was bothersome to her.  To the staff:  Take care of one person at a time and don't rush your patrons. If you must be interrupted, be apologetic so your customers know their time and patronage is appreciated and respected. If you can't give customers this attention they deserve, add more personnel. Your food is great, but the customer service could use improvement.

eXl0_ZA3kfL0MB2BKeDp0A.text: I fucking LOVE this place, ask anyone what my thing is .. And that's rootbeer floats. I'm a rootbeer float enthusiast. And guess what.. THEY BREW IT THEMSELVES! The rootbeer! Oh my fucking float masters of the heavens I was blessed. They have that shit on tap. So dinner CLEARLY was starting off pretty good. I ordered (what the waiter recommended) a grilled cheese panini, basil mozzarella heirloom tomatoes, add bacon and avocado. You have a thing of beauty and did I mention all the fries come in a Barbie size shopping cart?! Fuck yes.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roll this shopping cart down the table to share

dVocYHO-eOHwzqT4kIsaLg.text: Awesome gourmet burger restaurant! The Burger / Sushi menu is unique and evening I've ordered has been great.

RO5L7TzPJw-z_4VADpx_FA.text: Great palace for a midnight snack ! The food is ok but the staff are super friendly , very friendly atmosphere!

AEKjFzTM4lDHTSEvksvUWg.text: I'm super curious about how this restaurant came to be. I have two theories. One is that somebody just LOVES both sushi and burgers. The second is that they're trying to satisfy couples or groups where somebody wants sushi and somebody else wants burgers, and they're gonna please both. I also wonder if most people order both or stick with one. Of course, because we were there, I had to order both.  I was really just expecting both foods to be mediocre at best. It turns out that both were quite good. I appreciated the options of smaller burgers and 1/2 fry orders (plus mixed sweet potato and regular!!!).   Props to people who can mix bites of burger and sushi...I found it easier to finish the burger/fries and then have a sushi "dessert."   This place is totally weird, but it works for me.

kpBk4OTSXGuYdrBsg9treA.text: Get the mixed sweet/regular fries basket and a rootbeer.... ahhhhh awesome! The Delix burger burger is different but awesome, fresh and the bread is really good too. We tried the Vegas sushi roll and that was really good as well!

HCYv2XBtNmwX_Ma1YBOO8A.text: I mostly come here for the sushi which is awesome. However if you get the chance to try their sweet potato fries I would highly recommend it, the best sweet potato fries I've ever had. The staff here is nice and the food is really good, never had any issues here.

o1JTY3BkdhCJ_KAc-V2KlQ.text: As someone who has worked in a sushi restaurant, I'm a major sushi snob. I nitpick everything from the rice to the seaweed to the fish. I like Delux because the sushi is pretty decent and they're open late. I love love love their reverse happy hour! The service is pretty standard. Good ambiance, a little loud but still enjoyable. This is a great place to go alone and enjoy the late happy hour with a roll or two. They have an animated shark tank above the sushi bar which is fun to sit back and watch for a bit. I think the rolls are a little too thick to comfortably fit in your mouth in one bite (the rice ratio is a little off), but the roll varieties that I have tied have been really good. Definitely try the tiger roll is you are looking for something sweet and spicy!

wmMDJ3p7_0VOwiLGRI091Q.text: My wife finally got me to come here, as she claimed it was the best burger. Turns out it is not the same as Delux in Canada, (which I had several times) and now I am a full on Delux addict!!! It is the best burger you will ever have in your life. If you're lucky you will get Douglas as your server, he's definitely the best. So regardless if you're a visitor or resident of Phoenix go to Delux and indulge in burger heaven!

jkCKz-VyfxfioyAaOzOZ6A.text: Amazing! Yummy! Perfected!  That is three words to describe my experience (and many other experiences) at this restaurant.  The place is managed well from the top down.  I am always greeted immediately upon entry and have never (regardless of the hour) waited more than 30 seconds for a table.    Last night I had the Turkey Burger (outstanding, btw) and the sweet potato fries. I had the best service from Tara who was totally personable and on top of our drinks, meal, etc.  In the end she recommended a unique dessert that can only be found at their restaurant.  It was a chocolate cake with cream cheese icing and your choice of a flavor of ice cream.  I had the strawberry.  The dessert was spot on and I will definitely come back hungry for it.    I really do not think you can go wrong with their food. I have had many meals like the panini's, burgers, salads here over the past 3-4 years and they have always been good and consistent.  As a reminder, you get what you pay for, and I have no problem paying their reasonable prices for good quality food.  I can't wait to go back.

haLAwhK6GY-mKxUpyWPoAg.text: Great late night spot, the hours make it awesome.  Quality Sushi, love the sushi chef's, service is good all around, love the turkey burger & sweet potato fries as well as the dipping sauce.  Great location, great food, great service. I am a regular!

VFIbzKscCjJPAZFnOyv79Q.text: I LOVE this place. I've been coming here for the past year and every time it has been amazing. The happy hour prices are definitely worth it so I try to visit when that's going on. The sushi is amazing, always tastes fresh and I've never had an issue with the quality of my food. The service is great, I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated and the server Tara is amazing! I definitely recommend asking for her when coming in.

_2iOJW8PIUSfD6P4InKYOg.text: Delux is a great, they have won a gazillion awardsfor a reason. Their burgers amazing and their partnership with Niman Ranch makes for all natural veggie fed meats. They are open until 2am which is great for a lot of people who work in the service industry.   I've never tried the sushi as I always come for burgers but I heard it is pretty outstanding also. My favorite part about the food is they serve the fries in these cute little grocery  carts. It may be silly but I think it's pretty cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders

Q3hPKUxZUdhCuJDdwmJIMg.text: First time visiting this establishment and I must say I enjoyed every moment. Vanessa, my server, was absolutely AMAZING!!! She gave a new meaning to "customer experience." The place has a very great vibe, the atmosphere was perfect. The food was to die for!!! I will definitely be going back again and again. 5 STARS!!!

pRb2X-6B7wmYNZ4seA4utg.text: I remember coming here when I first moved to Phoenix,and thought these prices for a burger is ridiculous,but after having the delux burger with sweet potato fries,I quickly understood why,though I still thought this was expensive...Keep in mind this was 15 years ago, today I still understand why,these are damn good burgers.

14xWYxJ8w_LqY2p_uN_WZw.text: I had the Jumbo Hotdog. It was great! I loved that I could order my French fries mixed (regular & Sweet potato)

7RyX9jsgpIhQcqOI3NfVBw.text: Great food with a relaxing, yet upbeat atmosphere. The food is very clean tasting and filling. I recommend this place to people all over the valley.

Cr4Olurfik4KbLAbBLaIAA.text: If you are new in town or your first time here and you could only pick one thing to try, the Delux Burger is a must!  Cooks are excellent, quick, and consistent...the waiters not so much, they are very friendly but often forgetful and slow for simple requests.  Sushi is also probably the best I've had (although the portions are much smaller than they used to be but still the pretty high price) if it's packed you may not want to get sushi though the wait for sushi is often VERY long I'd say 75% of the time. I do remember one time I came and only ordered sushi, the rest of the table had already ordered, received, and finished their meals before I ever got my Sushi rolls this was the second time this had happened.  Overall though it's the quality of the ingredients and how they are combined that trumps the wait and makes everything here delicious and keeps us coming back no matter what.  Only docked the star for the speed and quality of service, the food otherwise is excellent, I only wish they had a westside location so we can go more often!

ZmkaVhqm6hpPLasZz17Ibw.text: Horrible service with to-go orders.  I had placed an order through Uber Eats that cost over $42 and only received half the order. When I questioned the driver he had no idea what I was talking about and replied the "Expo" verified the order, handed him one bag containing fries,and one of my two entree's. Not to mention Delux did not give the driver the $8 strawberry shake.   I called Delux and the manager Mikey declined any kind of guest satisfaction and told me that it was out of his hands.  The family of Reataurants I work for has and will do right by the guest and at drive any wrong orders (by the restaurant in question or by a 3rd party).   You lost a guest.

zxE3nxDmZucdx2DWCjb7AQ.text: Deliciousness -3.5/5 Happiness - 5/5  Delux is a really trendy place, with dim lights, fun decor and plenty of neon. It is also the restaurant I have visited most consistently since moving out to Phoenix. Being open until 2:00 AM is another huge plus, especially if your priority is food. I have spent many a late night poker winnings on the reverse happy hour sushi there.  The food is really good. Though it's a burger restaurant, I would say the hamburger, though good, is the least tasty option on the menu. This is literally the only place where I order the turkey burger over the hamburger. The spice blended into the turkey is excellent, and they load plenty of avocados on top. The veggie sandwich is a crowdpleaser and the mozerella and tomato sandwich/salad is also delicious. They recently added sushi to the menu and it is passable, but not particularly memorable.   The fries are the True stars of the show. I would absolutely recommend the mixed regular and sweet potato fries. They hare served with tasty aioli and ketchup.  They are delivered in mini shopping carts, which is a nice touch (and always puts a smile on new diners' faces).   The beer selection is a bit disappointing and overpriced, and rather than the hagen dasz milkshakes, I'd recommend walking across the lot to the nearby Gelato Spot.

d321QYwon9TAvCWQVD2IxQ.text: Absolutely loved it here! Where else can you get sushi and a burger at the same place?! We ordered the delux burger which was so delicious and juicy. We also ordered a philly roll which was absolutely perfect. Very cute ambiance and lighting. They are also open for food very late at night. Definitely recommend this.

xVUcA6XYZVseMOGwabMjZg.text: This place by far has the best burgers ever!! They are such good quality, made with such fresh ingredients. None of the food tastes old or processed. It's sooo good!!! Every-time I am craving a burger and some fries. I always order from this place. I have gotten the Delux Burger and the Classic Burger in the past and you can't go wrong with either one, such great flavor! Oh the fries are amazing as well. They always give you good portions. And the prices are amazing for high quality of food you receive! 10 out of 10! Definitely recommend! Everyone who I talk to about this place loves it and so do I!!

JCWFqV5FI4IyCvExldTQCA.text: Have not been here in many years. Still makes a very good burger and excellent fries. They have also Incorporated Zen 32 which was in the same shopping center owned by the same owner which does sushi. A little strange to have a burger sushi place but it is somewhat separated. Food and service are good. They pour a nice stiff drinks as well as have a good amount of craft beer on tap. Worth checking out if you are in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Asian chicken salad
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mini shopping cart of fries
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delux burger medium rare

HpG6BSmcjcbwf0-xoaIPPA.text: Delux is different, yeah it's different ...  Think outdoor pool club scene meets Niman Prime Angus gourmet burgers on Ciabatta meets sushi meets retro bakery menu. Sound weird? More like a True condensed description of Delux if you ask me.  To be honest I bookmarked Delux, because i love me a good burger and the little shopping cart holding the fries here are just so darn adorable- hey, what can I say I'm a sucker for cute packaging and eccentric food presentation.  I decided to go for their signature Delux burger and had a bottle of Kirin to share with my roomie- don't judge it was Happy Hour and the bottle was only $7.  Delux Burger- Fresh ground, all-natural, grain fed, niman ranch certified premium beef, caramelized onion & small bits of applewood smoked bacon, a blend of gruyere & maytag bleu cheeses & topped with baby arugula. served on a toasted, handcrafted demi-baguette (seems more like a ciabatta to me)  This is hardly a burger, if anything it's a burger for two. Comes in a demi baguette so it's in a strange oblong sandwich shape, nonetheless it is damn good! I got my patty medium- well and the beef was tender, juicy and had that signature niman ranch flavor. The cheese wasn't strong in bleu cheese and the touch of carmelized onions added a good sweetness. The arugula gave it a kick of pepper, but slightly and the bread was substantial enough to hold this huge burger all together without getting soggy.  Really good burger though I would say if you're a small gal like me share a burger with a friend and share an app as well. I ate only half of my burger and took the other half home and was stuff with the beer and all.   The environment was awesome to be in and service was good. A bit pricey, but for a gourmet burger this good- it's well worth it.

Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loving the use of Niman Ranch Beef for patties!
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delux Burger (All Natural Niman Ranch Patty cooked Medium Rare, Arugula, Gruyere-Bleu Cheese Blend &amp; Carmelized Onions)

Jeq3I-RYcFkTsJ4VK1377A.text: This is great food and the staff has great cocaine for sale. If you want to support addiction- tip well.

kL0J9_KZyeOUCqUpJs_YTw.text: Love this place! We go here a few times a month usually for the late night sushi. I've had a little bit of everything at this place!! Sushi is fresh! Veggie burger is really good and little shopping karts of fries are adorable!

aVMcxvvyyUDK1WxZDtn0NA.text: Second time here and it will be the last! We ordered sushi for my friend and a mahi sandwich for me, they were served at different times and we didn't eat together. The Mahi sandwich was over cooked and served with a salsa that was unrecognizable and inedible. No sides with a $17 sandwich, absurd! Not once were we asked how things were....I would have sent the mahi sandwich back, no one cares to even ask why I left it on my plate. Water glasses never filled and overall poor customer service, very tragic as I think they have potential. $112 for us to leave hungry and had dinner at separate times! 2 thumbs down!

xRvqrERvgZEKO6kbh_5kVg.text: Delicious food great service. In town for conference and this was a quick Uber away. The delux burger is the must get!

ZM2vhkgVqF1ICsnu9BlJVQ.text: The burgers are tasty but the service is soooooooo slllllooooooowwwwwwww. The burgers were served cold too. :(

LviBArNzPOyYzR9LT0OOSw.text: Great food, good service and respectful of the lunch hour.  I'll definitely be back as I now work nearby!

UCDkZiY7x5ZdU9HS9y7d0w.text: Nice atmosphere and a very trendy location with lots of options. Delicious burgers and food. Great selection of beer on tap with a full bar.

ZYAqXW2mubnD0tqMI5bPHg.text: On a Saturday night I was highly impressed with everything from the service to the food and atmosphere  Although busy my server, chelsey was amazing and although not veterans Day they approved a discount for me anyway. . that was indeed going able and beyond on any day besides it being very busy. .. and all my needs were met with no wait.   The atmosphere was busy but not overly loud where I couldn't hear my friends across from me  And the food. I know that my burger was so melt in you mouth awesome it could change a vegans mind. ..niman meat I looked it up and was very impressed about that farm  I give it 5 stars for all the above. I had a great time

gtveQXi_3RJvK-syxaehtQ.text: I was looking forward to try this place and I shouldn't have bothered to drive out of my way to eat here.  Food:  I ordered the sushi since i've read on yelp that their is really good.  It was edible.  Most of their rolls have mayo so if you love mayo, this is your place.  If you don't, then you are pretty limited in selections.  Service:  OK.  My server was nice and didn't mess up my order but I waited 30 mins to get my 2 rolls when they weren't busy.  Ambiance:  Bleh.  It was so dark in there, I had to use my cell phone to be able to read the menu.  Not a deal breaker.  But it was so cold in the restaurant, I had put on my jacket and eat my dinner in it.  That is ridiculous.  Will not be going back.

UO1LmmyFEOcqu1UGg-sKIA.text: When I die, I would like to be buried with the Delux Burger, Fries (please don't forget the aioli) and a yummy IPA fresh from the tap.   The Delux Burger brings you a little closer to heaven. Cooked and seasoned to perfection. Topped with a guyere and blue cheese mixture, coupled with sauteed onions and arugula. All on a brioche bun. The ingredients are super fresh and the meat is all grain-fed. Mommy daddy this thing is a symphony in my mouth!   Then add this lovely burger into an equation of a massive beer list. Not your usual Crud Light but lovely Microbrews. AND good prices? AND they are open until 2am 7 days a week?!? Not to mention that the service was outstanding?  I'm floating on a cloud. Please don't get me down. The taste of Delux Burger and Sunbru is lingering in my mouth. What's that? I'm slipping! The Burger is weighing me down. Falling. NO! Back to reality. Damn.  I contemplated ordering another Burger to get that moment back...I guess I will have to come back tomorrow...

7Qw-7lBAGDOZAYR_3H_udw.text: This is my favorite burger joint as Delux has the best burgers for taste.  I've never had a problem with the food here, only thing I find strange at times is sometimes the wait staff has a bit of an attitude, which is funny considering it's a burger place.  I know it's in the Biltmore-arcadia area but la de da.  This last visit was funny as I saw some parents bring a bunch of children here.  This does not seem like the type of place to bring your child, totally odd, but whatever rocks your boat.

MiRzwm9OXvmt_gtOOHbllA.text: Headline: Nothing Special  The headline pretty much sums up my visit. Neither the food, the service, nor the location were anything special.  I had the delux burger, which on paper should be a real winner. Unfortunately it turned out to be a big pile of *meh*.. Same with the fries.  The beer selection is decent with a few local brews that I haven't seen elsewhere.  I wouldn't mind giving it another try if I'm in the area again, but it seems like there are some better options pretty close by.

7DoM4b0M84y0GkMfQmJDmw.text: good for late night eats. Good burger patty but please change the bun already. Too much bread.

ckSVby8HYKnkaAj5FCvAxg.text: I am a regular. High quality meat, Nieman's  Great burgers, hot dog is out of this world. fun place, small but good. Want fabulous service, ask for Brad, he is the beat. This restaurant just added another side and now serves sushi too. Try it, it will not disappoint. Open till 2am I think.

mXFTJno0nU6_UlzW9ixlzw.text: I was pleasantly surprised that, during Happy Hour, my date and I were able to order a California Roll, Las Vegas Roll, seaweed salad, and a beer for $20. It was a good meal at a good price! I can't speak for their sushi prowess, considering we ordered pretty tame rolls. But the service was spot on and I left satisfied. Can't wait to come back and take on the American side of their menu!

tt6l2fkUoEsu5ueRLJCXTw.text: The best BEST best BEST sweet potato fries. Good consistency with awesome seasoning! Sweet potato fries never really crisp up the way regular fries do, but there is so much flavor to these that you hardly notice they're a little limp! And served in mini silver shopping carts, which is surprisingly more cool than trying-too-hard. Burger patty is seasoned really well and is HUGE. Be careful when you order it medium-rare... it might come out a little more rare than you're expecting (soggy in the middle... but still oh so good).

pW1XUlvZzEPDDjU5SE2Lzg.text: Another must stop for us while we're in AZ. We've had a lot here too - beers and food! Last time I got the beat salad - filled me up w/o ruining my appetite for beers :) And "shopping cart fries" get the blend and don't forget that yellow/orange sauce!! Can't wait to try their sushi element next!

X-wvadTyN0Nk2R9qlPz8rw.text: All I can say is, this is our favorite burger place. LOVE the sweet potato fries...even my wife loves them, and she's not much of a fry person! The burgers are big and juicy, plus they're all natural from Niman Ranch, I wish more restaurants would catch on to healthier options like Delux has. Employees are usually nice and give great service. The only slightly bad thing about this place is that they get really busy at night, especially the weekends...probably because everyone knows how good they are! So if you go at any peak time, expect to wait a little bit. They can usually seat a 2-4 party in 15-20 minutes if they're swamped. I only wish they had a location near us, but we drive half an hour to come here!

Wysvw-k0p4bLIEIzPHedYw.text: We came here for their reverse happy hour. Our server was very attentive, nice, and friendly. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great late happy hour. Not to mention the food is delicious!!!

Eb2VlBGH5ec9rx0ZhPdX7Q.text: Delux is by far one of the best beer and burger spots in the valley. I recommend getting a classic with double applewood smoked bacon and cheddar. Add a mini-shopping cart filled with sweet potato and regular fries and you have the perfect cure for previous evening overindulgences!   As an added bonus, Delux is currently featuring Lagunitas Brown Shugga' on tap, which is an amazing american strong ale.

7HOgGt9TnI4SqlhCGNZbcg.text: the burgers are GREAT!! and the vanilla bean beer is good. the fries are better then most. it has the snottsdale vibe but not as bad as most spots "in snottsdale" the waiters kinda give that "I want a huge tip just because" service. I like the food but not the vibe.. lets be clear.. they may have the best burger in town despite of all the other BS.

e6SBPcMr97ipZ1YBqOtA2A.text: I love this restaurant.  I've been a patron for several years now, and I find the food to be very consistent.  The atmosphere is cool, very low-key and casual.  I also love that they're open until 2AM (at least on weekends... I'm not sure about weekdays).    I cannot post a review about Delux without recommending both the Delux burger and sweet potato fries.  The burger has always been cooked medium-rare, as ordered (don't hunt me down if they mess yours up), and the fries are worthy of being served at the Pearly Gates.  Said another way, I USED to think The Vig Uptown had the best sweet spuds in town.    I can also vouch for the beet salad and Chinese chicken salad.  Oh, and the Haagen Dazs strawberry shake/malt thing will make your messy divorce seem like a lighthearted disagreement.  And before you complain about the $6 price tag, remember how much your divorce lawyer cost you...  They also serve sushi now, and although I won't go anywhere near it (I was born this way!), I did sample my friend's Vegas roll, and...yeah... why don't you try those too.    The reason I award 4 and not 5 stars is because I find the service to be inconsistent.  Sometimes it can be great, and other times, I feel like my server would rather be anywhere else.  Considering that I eat out alone a lot, an absent or bland server can ruin a dining experience for me.  Don't project your bad day onto me, please.  Ain't nobody got time for that!

nlZUEmJMiCQRGJJEXHBpsw.text: Fresh food! High quality burgers, good presentation as well. The Toasted baguette with olive oil and balsamic was a delicious starter. Fair prices & service at the bar was good.. We will be back

OR3qu17JswFtXTsk6eDGew.text: Delux Burgers are excellent. The french fries are shoestring and served in wonderful shopping carts.  Delux is may be the ONLY restaurant in Phoenix open until 2AM nearly (or every) night of the week. And they have been in business for over five years now, no surprises about hours changing, running out of menu items etc. Very dependable.  Decent wait staff too.  Negatives: Besides the burgers, I think the rest of the menu is mediocre. Don't try to go at normal dining hours, else you'll wait and wait.  Try to avoid sitting at the long plank-style table in the middle of the room, unless you enjoy sitting on an uncomfortable stool with everyone else in the room staring at your back. Oh, and its noisy too.

1lcvkE8sLmsWzAo45RB0ew.text: Interior lighting has been brightened, thus losing the cool-hip and dim feel that I craved so much from DELUX. Liquor menu is WAY OUT dated, staff made no effort to compensate. Prices have gone up. Service is consistently INCONSISTENT. There's a TON of places where you can get an $8 cocktail and $10 burger..

IzPwiVt3sYqbwRtyV5YUeA.text: Tasty crazy good burgers and even a deluxe hot dog! Their chicken salad has celery seed and red grapes in it, and if you've never tried that combination, you've never had chicken salad. I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries, and Delux does great sweet potato fries. The house aioli is great, I recommend the mixed basket of sweet potato and regular fries. If you still have room after that, get the float made with the stout. Happy Hour's good, everything's good!

kpI8XiFhRRS4S5q7uwpcVQ.text: It's pretty good.    Is it the best burger in AZ?  Nah.  I'd rather have Zinburger any day.  Way more flavor.

AFtanG_5-h0fLzPe9pLm7A.text: Overpriced. Grass fed hamburger or not... If I'm paying for an overpriced 12 dollar burger why the heck does it not come standard with fries.  Oh wait. That is $10 for an entire stash.

mLBdT3iQwLSipms1carT-A.text: Went during lunch hour. Service was really slow in the beginning and then rushed towards the end. The burger was good, but nothing fantastic.   The fries were the highlight oddly-- they came in mini shopping carts and the spicy mustard-y sauce it came with was tasty.  I'm curious to see what the sushi side of the restaurant is like, so I'll return to check it out.

9wOR-hfKorErYOg9plqQHg.text: This place is okay.  It seems like I always have to ask them to remake my burger, I always ask for it medium well because there standard medium rare is very rare, and it is always way undercooked the first time. After that they get it right.

WueyWEx4cnyVDZWQTig6vQ.text: I want to dislike this place.  Why?  Because it's aims to add pretension to the humble hamburger joint - does any town need another restaurant selling a 15$ burger & fries?    But damnit if they don't have a tasty burger and fries.  Well constructed with great flavor and texture combinations.  Their delux burger is unequivocally delicious and, at least the one I was served tonight, perfectly cooked to my specified temperature.  I comment about this because far too few places get the basics correct.  Delux did tonight.

rpX0ylajSH4NgcpWqkcbeg.text: 1. Fries in a mini shopping cart(strange but cool concept) 2. sushi and burgers(it used to be no sushi, but now i love this concept, you could eat sushi and burgers, my favorite foods in one place. 3. happy hour(awesome deals, food and drinks0 4. open till like 2 am, when all other restaurants are closed Delux is still open) 5. BEST BURGER IN ALL ARIZONA, and probably one of the best i had anywhere outside arizona. theres a reason this burger keeps winning best burger in az. their Delux Burger is just delicious. The meat is melt in your mouth(make sure to order medium rare, otherwise you cant get the full benefits) two people can eat from one, and im a 6'1 guy so i could have enough with half. I would choose sweet potatoe over regular fries.   *****Once you try this burger you wont be able to enjoy others, as you will always compare it to this(just keep in mind, theres fast food, pub burgers and then there's Gourmet Burgers, Delux being gourmet; you cant put others in the same line.   AVG burger price: $11 fries: $5 or $6

XUnAwXES_dCeppDDCrJu_w.text: The food and ambience was great as always. The service tonight was above and beyond thanks to our server Douglas!

uqNCVVr_rbGvyj2BlaVz9g.text: Nice upscale joint but service is way below par. Took a lot to get the waiter's attention, he didn't even serve me my food, I had to signal the cook to serve it to me as it was just sitting on the hot plate with the waiter nowhere to be seen. Food was good though. Most likely will not return here.

dCtujlmIlDHQBFMhSCBJ2w.text: The sub sandwich of burgers. Seriously. I could only eat half and I can put it away.  The patty is just so thick, I couldn't handle it.    I must really need to get laid if that last sentence about a thick hamburger sounded sexual to me.  Anyway, besides the thickness factor, the hamburger was delicious-- medium rare, melty Gruyere cheese, bacon and onions cooked together in what makes a gooey, slightly sweet BBQ-like sauce.  I also partook in one of the beer flights... and then I partook in my friend's beer flight because I forced him to get one even though he doesn't like beer (Insuring that I would end up with two beer flights-- nothing in life is random, wait, everything in life is random... I'm confused.  How about nothing in life is random where beer is concerned?).  The sweet potato fries were soft. I like a little more crunch in my fry. Who wants a flaccid fry? Not me. I could bend them in all sorts of shapes, none of which were useful.    I think I liked the ambiance more than the food, but the food was good too. Or maybe I had too much beer and this review, tainted with sexual innuendos, is worthless. Either way, a must try.        P.S. I hope people I only know in passing never read this.

ayXEYgMh48NlfajPg6QqhQ.text: There certainly was nothing wrong with my experience here - the service was excellent, the atmosphere is very cool, they have an impressive draft list - but I just don't see what the buzz is about with the food. I am not complaining about it by any means, but it just didn't knock my socks off. Our order included the signature burger, sweet potato fries, and the chicken salad sandwich. The fries were great. The burger was well constructed, though the temperature was a bit over the medium rare that I ordered (this is also how they recommend it). I'm not surprised as the patty was probably only half an inch thick. It was still juicy and the flavor was fine. The chicken salad sandwich was gargantuan, but its contents were a bit lacking of flavor and the chicken was a touch on the dry side.  All in all, it's certainly worth a shot if you've never tried it. I didn't really see the value in it at the moderately high prices so I doubt it will come to mind when deciding on where to eat, but maybe it'll do it for you.

pS6VyZvEuHdyZqkmgk_9rQ.text: I come her all the time and the service is hit or miss. Ask for autumn she is she beat and so cute!

bJyag15XNUQMO9QjaWBHIw.text: Always loved this place.  Come here every time I'm in Phoenix.  This time I had a waitress that seemed distracted (yeah you, the one who was working this Saturday afternoon) And didn't smile much or was having internal conversations while she was dropping utensils and clashing plates.  She was preoccupied when she took my order and totally forgot my fries...wasn't even on the bill.  I don't know, when a burger waitress forgets fries orders she should be fired.  She apologized when I told her and she said she was just looking out for my diet.  Cute, but where is the incentive to come back?  I mean forgetting fries with a burger is pretty obscene.  She pissed me off so much I don't want to go back for a while. I guess my point is that service doesn't represent the individual but the restaurant as a whole.  If they hire people who have no understanding of customer satisfaction and they are no longer representing the restaurant but only themselves, then it means the restaurant is slipping as they are no longer managing service.  This waitress clearly was not representing the restaurant, or even aware she was working. The decline of good consistent service is a bad sign.

AXDuxLpo8PXw07Hy2ObmqQ.text: Okay so Delux needs to revoke whatever ill-conceived licensing agreement they entered into with the cretins over at the airport. That "Delux" burger--if you can even call that wretched mass a burger--was the absolute worst single thing I have ever consumed in my whole entire life. The free burgers they give you at this boat-shaped strip club in south Tucson on Fridays far exceeded the "Delux" burger in both quality and taste.   The real Delux burger is quite good. In fact, its one of my favorites. So, when I sunk my unwitting teeth into this sham and discovered it's pre-frozen mass-produced patties, cheap-ass American cheese, McDonald's tomatoes, stale "Brioche" bun, and conspicuous lack of a tasty condiment capable of masking the mess, you can probably imagine my soul-crushing disappointment.   This thing costs like $14, which is more expensive than a real Delux burger if I recall. I'll never see my poor $14 again. My poor $14 is now in the hands of some godless heathen who's probably reinvesting it to buy licenses from other unsuspecting local business owners. I should be reimbursed that $14 to pay for the colon cleanse I'm gonna need in an hour. My sad, sad anus...   This experience, suffice it to say, has taught me that there is no justice in this world. What's happening over here at Sky Harbor needs to stop ASAP. I am posting this to the actual Delux page to raise awareness, and politely urge the owners of Delux to put this to an end.

AY3-L6gx0GTKqnnF-4FBBg.text: AWESOME BURGERS! This is the top of the foodie chain. Fries were perfectly cooked, burger was amazing. Went with the house special and couldn't be better. WILL BE BACK!

9T_oBFL-xLmrEkfbsGnuoA.text: The Delux burger is huge! I shared it with a friend and still couldn't eat it all. And the basket" of fries was a hoot! I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the basket of sweet potato fries!

11TFXnv0dVpW7BwGnUktAQ.text: I was on the fence at first but the burgers were simply outstanding.  The sweet potato fries were excellent.  I wanted to try the 7 dollar cupcake but we were having a birthday event.  Next time I am getting it!  The staff was friendly, made a spot for 8 of us and even helped us sing happy birthday.

oXfYKpSZRM6zTMSuWimSuQ.text: Burgers aren't horrible....   mine was very under cook (asked for medium, I got rare) server was nice but in all... there still a greasy, flat top cooked burger! And it was $50 for 2 beers 2 burger and SHARED fries! (Although the order of fries is HUGE). And lastly hopdotty is in NORTH Scottsdale... Much better burgers and much less expensive

p75OKVwuuy95iNAj6w3R_Q.text: I love love love Delux.. Can't believe I haven't reviewed. I have never been disappointed. Delux Burger.. fries.. beer.  It's all about the buns.. soft, pillowy buns.  Then the meat.. juicy, rare, and flavorful.  Throw cheese, onions, and bacon on that bitch, and it's over. You're crazy for this one D-   Hov

QckjDwy7i01hk_VosCHJSA.text: Was served a dirty glass of water with lipstick on it, asked for a clean one and a kids menu. Get neither. Had to ask again. Waiter didn't take the dirty glass away. Every time I talked to the waiter, I had to repeat myself. Asked for a lettuce wrapped burger which then came on a bun over 20 minutes later. Not pleased with the service and will not be returning.

HHLCt86hvIV9ITH2KczG1w.text: Amazing burger ( I ordered the delux and split an order of the minis), amazing fries, and most importantly they have an amazing well gin (Bulldog - I highly recommend a gin & tonic). Their key lime pie was also amazing but I can't recommend it at the price per portion. This is THE burger place to go.

YBzwFGNtja2qTBybasM9ZQ.text: Delux burger medium rare (how they recommend it)...mmmmm!!! Such a good burger and get mixed fries so you can try their sweet potato ones as well. They come with great dipping sauces and in a little shopping cart which is cute and funny. I like the atmosphere inside, and they have a little patio too if it's not too hot. It's also open really late. I've never gone late....but I like knowing I have the option.

wQ2hBFwTSKgsV1bttri6tA.text: Ate there again on Fri night (3/28)... consistently great.    Once again, late night dining in a nice casual hipster environment. Service was great as (almost) always. Food is timely and awesome. Sushi is adequate remembering that they are more a burger place than a hard core sushi place but it was certainly well prepared and taste great.  If they could just do something about the crazy menus...

_uVFYtWljcaIn5oPwRjyrQ.text: Amazing Food, Service and Ambiance!  Visiting Phoenix / Fountain HIlls for a convention this week - my father-in-law found Delux Burger on either Yelp or Trip Advisor (he can't remember where). We had dinner there tonight... arrived early (on a sunday evening about 5:45), tons of space to sit inside. They had a great atmosphere and amazing food and service. Matthew took excellent care of us, and the food was exceptional. One of those experiences where you wish this place was "in your neighborhood" - the other servers were also attentive (to our needs) and super- friendly!

CJeMkDW54Hm2jIUjOHU-mQ.text: Amare Stoudemire used to eat here when he was playing for the Suns; you may disagree with his move to the Knicks, but you should trust his judgement in burgers.   The Delux signature burger is pretty awesome, but I'm going to be real: I like the grilled cheese or the hot dog much better than the burgers. Even better than either of these are the sweet potato fries with aeoli sauce!  The service is fantastic! The waiters are some of the nicest I've ever met. Try to get Brad if you can!  Delux is open late, so it is the best place to go for food after a long night at the bars or clubs!

P9VHKk613qq3AX5gcsXmRg.text: First time here, very welcoming. I love the atmosphere, very clean,  and friend staff. The food was good, not great, but good.i had the delux burger(which was recommended by our server) basket of fries, shrimp tempura toll, California roll, and a spicy tuna roll. The burger was good, cooked to order, not dry, and very filling. The sushi was ok, not too satisfied with it. Overall a good experience, and will be coming back.

2DEYJlD2YNHOBq_Tgyxtag.text: This place was recommended by our uber driver and he was right it was fantastic. Root beer float was awesome, fries were great. Green chili corn soup was out of this world and the burgers bar none the best

l8uA2Icyn_FcaOj_7f4baA.text: I have heard of this place over and over for years, but since I really don't eat beef all that often, I had never visited... until yesterday. Let me just tell you, that friggin' Delux Burger is my new "GO TO" for premenstrual MEAT cravings!  Wow, it was a crazy delicious shot of iron my body needed. Honestly, I am salivating like Pavlov's dog just writing this review. Crap... now I'm starving.  Go. Get the burger. You'll thank me later.

OgJpr-TJZMoQ6S8BgpOCXQ.text: The line is there because the burgers are excellent. You must go here for burgers and fries. It's great! And the delux are good, too! Get the fair delux.

BfudJs5tW3RGUK2gaeA9Sg.text: Delux is a real boon to the Biltmore/Arcadia area and is probably one of the few good restaurants open in Phoenix until to 2 AM. The place does fill up fast, so I prefer to go there on off-hours, especially during the reverse happy hour. The bartenders are very friendly.  The burgers are large and tasty. The fries are some of the best I have ever had. The bar is well-stocked with a large variety of beers, wines, and spirits. I tried a hot dog at Delux once and thought it was good, but I suggest sticking with the burger and fries.

1NLZGrVOJ-ZjBkjFy9fEZA.text: 3 words......Sweet Potato Fries! Sure they have burgers to die for, but when you get a shopping cart of those fries..... man you can die a happy man.  Great service,  friendly people,  awesome beer on tap.

WBUcOmcPheVrkBe7SfKlQQ.text: Delux sounded really good, so I decided to grab a burger for an early lunch.  I had heard from others that it was really good.   The service was excellent and for that alone, I give Delux 5 stars however..  I ordered a cup of coffee $2.50,  a half order of sweet potato and regular fries $3.5 and the delux burger with bacon and avocado $10.90 (typo in the menu it said $9.90) and $1.50 for the bacon and avocado. It was over $21, crazy!  The bill was high for what I got I think , compared to other restaurants, definitely not worth it.   Fries, awesome, in the top 5 for best sweet potato fries but not the best in town, sorry, I do have my favorites!  The burger was not a tasty as I imagined it to be.  Yes, it was fresh, but it wasn't that tasty even with the extra bacon and avocado, and usually I devour burgers if they are good regardless of the size, this one I didn't.   Delux has a wonderful outside venue and is a great place to hang with friends and maybe share a burger and fries, but I wasn't blown away as I thought I would be.  I gave the restaurant a 3 because of pricing and just the taste of the burger, it wasn't that great.

8Ei0mihv1ZUtaN1FxQe6uw.text: One of my favourite burger places I've visited, and I love me a good burger. The decor is nice and modern. They serve fries and sweet potato fries in a mini shopping cart, mixed if you want them. So yummy! The burger was great too. Nothing disappointing about this place. Quite impressive for a burger joint. I guess in America they take their burgers more seriously than in Canada.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. shopping cart of fries with ketchup &amp; chipotle dip

qedJ6myws9DGmxZeR0SDiA.text: This place is awesome! Great burgers and the fries are to die for! Jon was our server and was so helpful and charming, it made our experience even better!

d0UkXsK-Sa0Q1fBJcgIyNQ.text: What a fun hip place for a burger and a beer on tap!  Everything I've had here has been great!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NjxPadaJUUbxerxBXWokZQ.text: Excellent food, perfect burger, fries served in a shopping cart.  Go for the classic standard burger.  Perfect brioche bun, that lends to the perfect bite of very tasty beef and cheese.  I really can't wait to go back.  There is also a very good selection of beers on tap, each served in their respective branded glasses. Nothing more to say.  Just go and try it.

U_szrXhQhRW8SGywqXPs-w.text: I was pretty excited to go to Delux, and had been meaning to try it for some time, but I finally got around to it this last weekend.  I'd heard how great their burgers were and that if you wanted to spend a little more than the average to get a fantastic burger, that was the place to go.    So, off we went to give it a shot.  We got there at around 6 or 6:30 on Saturday and the place was pretty busy, although there was no wait.  We were seated at the tables along the west wall.  Talk about an awkward entry onto the booth side.  The tables are so close together, there's no graceful in or out.   To the table next to me... I'm so sorry I invaded your space.  Some other reviewers have said it was loud, boy were they right.  It was quite noisy and crowded, even the servers had trouble getting around the people & I did hear 1 tray of dishes hit the ground.    On to the ordering... 1/2 the menu is drinks.  From beers to wines, they have you covered & I appreciated the options.  Food menu is small to average, but a decent selection of items. My boyfriend & I opted to both go for the Delux Burger.  Can't go wrong with the namesake, right?  High quality beef with arugula and a blend of cheeses, onions, and bacon.  mmmmm ... bacon.    As we waited anxiously for the tasty treats, I got nervous. I heard the woman next to me say, "I seem to be missing my bacon".  I saw her pull her burger apart, searching, and no bacon.  I was hoping it was a one time oversight and that my burger would come with bacon, as promised.  Not so.  Both my boyfriend and I were lacking our bacon.  Our server was just attentive enough to not be MIA, but if I'd waited for him to come back so that I could point out my lack of yummy pork product, I'd have been sitting another 15 minutes with food in front of me that, although lacking a bit, was fairly tasty.    This brings me to the fries.  Everyone keeps posting how fantastic the sweet potato fries were.  Um, yeah, average at best.  We got the 1/2 and 1/2 basket and both types were limp and bland.  They were only cooked to the point of being 'just done'.  No crispiness.  It made me sad.  Oh, and I have to throw this in, when asked if we wanted desert, we politely declined & said we were all set.  Apparently, that is server code for, "No more fries for you!".  Yup, he snatched up that basket of fries without asking if we were done.   All in all, I didn't hate it, but wow, I sure was hoping for something better.  You know, that gem of a place that you get a craving for.  Maybe it's like that blockbuster movie that you've heard so many good things about, you can't wait to see it, but it's been so built up that it winds up being a let down.  I'm not sure if it was an off night, but I'm also not sure I'll go back.

6Jl1PR0XEEi6al1igGO4Kg.text: Ummm I wasn't impressed. The burger was alright (not as tasty as I hoped) and nothing I would go out of my way for. The sweet potato fries were good but again I wouldn't go out of my way for. My coke was mostly carbonated water and I feel it was too pricy for what it was. I'd rather go to In and Out. There was sushi on the menu too so I guess that says something.  It was a lot of food but I didn't want to take it home.

0U-CDug4k74U14CHESfNwg.text: Will not be going back. Food was flavorless and for the price I rather eat three Cheeseburgers at In and Out. Chicken tasted like it was not seasoned at all and the veggies that were suppose to come on the sandwich were more like 3 small slices and that was it. Waitress was just not helpful, slow, and seemed like she did not want to be at work at all. A smile goes a long way.

SZvnB64x0Lnz8XqDfa4lqw.text: Their fries are the best! The food is great and I can always get a good martini here. Plus they are open late, have patio seating and added sushi to their menu. Definitely a must try!!

jc3VYiog0NMGRM8U0eDpyQ.text: I've heard all the hype for years and this place turned out to be precisely what I expected; overblown nonsense that wishes it were in Manhattan.  We came here late night, post dinner rush around 9:30pm on a week night.  Sat on the patio. Had horrible service; slower than molasses in January in Anchorage Alaska.  Our server (if you can call him that -- he was more like an entitled lump expecting a tip), Christian never came back to check on us, offer refills or ask about dessert. I had to practically ambush him like a guerrilla warrior to get him to bring me the check. After that we waited another 10 minutes for him to run my card, even though the patio was empty.  The food was OK,but nothing memorable or extraordinary.  I'd sooner eat McDonald's Dollar Menu burgers then spend money here again.  Just a waste or my time and money.

tFlt2bU1NC4IrmLM6-CDZw.text: Best restaurant in the valley that serves not only the best burgers in town but also excellent sushi! It's my #1 favorite restaurant.

s1pFqxgmd8kp6R48HWl2pg.text: I had time between picking up my daughter at the Phoenix airport at 9 p.m. and picking up my other daughter at 11 p.m.! Our concierge recommended Delux since it is open late, has delicious food, and offered a safe place for us ladies to go on a Friday night. My daughter got what she said was a fresh, delicious rainbow roll, and we enjoyed sitting on their patio on a pleasant evening. Delux has a great menu of burgers and sushi!

U99piPu-WFFpoEBzxquHeg.text: Came here after a long afternoon at asu and we were impressed! Greeted us as soon as we walked in and our server Nick was so nice! He made sure everything was good and he continued to check on us even after we were done eating!

YEP6jaH6H2uCo2lLooOljQ.text: For the price of their food you would think that they would be more picky with their waitstaff. The restaurant is cool and has a nice vibe. The food was good but not really worth the extravagant prices for it. The sauce they give you to dip your fries in, I believe is a garlic aioli, was out of this world. The burger and sushi we got were good but nothing you couldn't get at a fraction of the price at several other establishments nearby. The service we got was deplorable. Our drinks sat empty most of the time, the servers were standing around joking not paying any attention and they put both charges for our bill on one card instead of splitting it between the two like we had asked. We had to call and get it taken off by our bank. Won't be back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger, special lollipop roll and a spicy tuna roll. Definitely not worth the $100 tab.

gR-MmuV7yjq66IGbX0AiJw.text: This place is definitely unique since it offers several different types of food from sushi to burgers. I know it may sound strange, but they combined the two separate restaurants and turned them into one. Highly recommend the sweet potatoes fries. They are thin sliced with the perfect amount of crunch to them. Plus it comes with ketchup and spicy mayo for dipping. Also, if you are going for a vegetarian option, the vegetable panini was on point and filling. The waiter was awesome! He was super kind, knew the menu VERY well, and offered add-ons options (ex: Asian chicken panini instead of the regular chicken because the Asian chicken one is marinated in orange juice and saki - and even throwing some avocado in there). Kudos to your Ryan for being knowledgeable about the restaurant! I feel like I would come back to this place especially since they are open late everyday and they have something going on everyday of the week (Sunday's is tequila Sunday!)

SRcG3SWNioL3bWumpUlkig.text: Always great. A Phoenix institution. Open late every night. Only place where you can get beer, burgers and great sushi at the same time after midnight any day of the year. Thanks Lenny!

z2hEvJW3v6WfcAdA3ScaQg.text: This place is amazing!!! I am from Oregon and can't wait to get back here!!!  We went twice on our trip we just made in October.  My boyfriend got the burger on the first trip w a mix of regular fries and sweet potato fries.  I tried them it was amazing and he was very happy as well!  Mallory was our server and she was amazing! Super nice and friendly and helpful!  I had sushi and omg it was the best I've ever had and it was so fresh and good!!!  We went again and I got sushi again bc it was so yummy I had to have more!  We had Mallory as our server again and she was so nice and always had answers to our questions and didn't get annoyed at us!!  Thanks Mal!  We can't wait to come back!! Please open a location in Eugene! I would come everyday!!

tDYo9adUeOBVAFY_26U8pw.text: Went here tonight for my first time after a long shift at work. Thankfully they're open till 2am and I didn't have to settle for fast food. I was so ready to order a bunch of sushi when I found out the sushi bar isn't open as late as the restaurant on weekdays. Bummed. But not a big deal.  So I browsed the rest of the menu and decided on the Chinese chicken salad (I think it was called) and the delux burger with sweet potato fries and regular fries mixed. Salad was a nice size and very very tasty. The burger came out shortly after along with a side of some kind of sauce and ketchup. The sauce was orangeish in color and looked like spicy mayo, and let me tell you it was AMAAAAAZING with the sweet potato fries. I couldn't have been more pleased with the food.  The very best part of my visit, however, was when Lenny, the owner came over to casually say hello and introduce himself which is such a nice touch to a dining experience, I believe. We chatted for about ten minutes. He's owned restaurants before and he's been in the business for a very long time, and it shows through this restaurant. I was impressed that he was there so late, it really shows that he puts a lot of time and effort into his place.   Needless to say, I 100% recommend this place, not only for the great quality and taste of the food, but to support local business! I will be back soon to try the sushi. :)

ol191DmIJ5NE7la8Bs24Mg.text: This is the best burger joint in Greater Phoenix. The kale salad was complex, served with a delicious blend of nuts, greens and cranberries. You can taste the pure beef in the burgers. The beef is not from animals that have been fed antibiotics. The fries are made to order and are not oily or greasy. Excellent service.

kpJd6vVfUW8BTcwGI5mUZQ.text: This is one of my favorite burgers spots in Arizona and I'm not a burger type of person but sushi is on point only thing made me upset was that they took for ever to ask me anything I waited about 20 min for someone to take my order would of been 5 star

rXpNW7qSZ6O-4w748XqL_A.text: The Burgers are great but pricey for just a burger and no fries. Unfortunately I ordered the kayle salad and it was not good.

C4UFzax-s5ZtOuahoafMWA.text: I absolutely love this place! Sushi is always outstanding, service is always friendly. It's our go-to spot for late night food. Love that it's open late! Kailani (I hope I spelled it correctly) is very sweet and showed us a special sushi menu that wasn't on the regular menu, and went out of her way for us. I can always rely on Delux for great food and awesome service!

z_3cgOv7rN1V0Q9BD0MmCA.text: Great food, but why did we have to get a bad server!! When I say bad, I asked for aioli and mustard when our burgers came out and I got to the point where I just walked up to the kitchen window and damn near was about to pour my own sauce. I know how it goes where people can get overwhelmed quickly and forget things, but that's what attributes to the overall experience.  Order from the late night happy hour with margarita (frozen and on the rocks) along with some sushi (from Zen) and the 2 slider burgers!!!   I don't make it by as often like I use when in the area, but the food, fries and atmosphere help to look past the 'odd' service. Other members of the staff helped out which was good. Even ordered a 2nd round of sushi to make sure we left 'fulfilled' with no lingering hunger.   Lots of options and good food so give anything a shot you won't be disappointed.

dLekKwGc8EsSI3OtEF49QQ.text: Delux never seems to disappoint, open late for obvious reasons and delicious. Service was on point and they all work together flawlessly as a team. Narrow chic restaurant that reminds me of living in NY where the coolest restaurants are small dark and narrow. Good use of space but NOT a fan of the long Island table in the center with non moveable stools, you could potentially be shoulder to shoulder with a complete stranger. Everyone tonight had the Delux burger which they all were satisfied, I HAD to go with the grilled cheese my "go to" it is one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I have had in my life, fresh bread and it is almost like a tomato basil salad complete with mozzarella and a blend of other cheeses (perfection) it's so colorful and fresh you'd swear it was healthy. Fries both sweet potato or regular delicious! With great aioli which we kept dipping and dipping until my friend and I noticed a "glow" at the bottom of the dip cup from the glowing table.......it was a HOLE in the bottom, I don't know how that got past chef prep but it wasn't a huge deal just "things that make you go hmmmm".

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sauce with a hole
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aftermath

8HAp1UIIu-fTrD4_dNepRA.text: I placed a pick up order today at 7:01pm for two Chinese chicken salads. I was quoted 15-20 minutes for the food to be ready and might I add the person I spoke with on the phone was less that polite or nice. I arrive at 7:16pm to the curb side pick up and call to let them know I was there. The same person I spoke with earlier answered the phone and said "oh it's not ready and you can come inside to get it." I said no I'll get wait out here thanks. So now it's 7:26pm and still no food or anything. At this point I am very annoyed. So my aunt calls this time to see what happened with our order and still the order isn't ready. So at this point we both go inside and ask to speak with the manager. I don't remember the managers name, I think it may have been Jared. Anyways I explain to him THREE times what the situation was and yet he still was confused. I was even showing him my phone with the times the order was placed, yet he still had a super confused look on his face. He then shows us the order ticket that he or someone else just placed at 7:27pm!!!!!! I was absolutely appalled. I was like "what?!? I placed the order at 7:01, called at 7:16 and NOW the order is only being made?! I don't understand!" Instead of apologizing he said he will comp only salad and only charge for a jr for the other one but we still had to wait. We have now both lost our appetite and say "forget the salads we are leaving, you could have at least been open and honest with us that someone dropped the ball and forgot to place the order BOTH times we called or even just said sorry."   Our family has been coming to this restaurant for 10 years and this was extremely disappointing. I actual don't even live in this state anymore and visiting from the Bay Area so I tried to make it a point to visit one of my favorite restaurants but I will no longer return. The poor service is not worth the food and we will take our business else where.   Come here/ order at your own risk -- you may leave disappointed like we were.

AZb1j5drFq5j9pfRGjavOA.text: The location of this place could definitely be better and the seating options is definitely a little weird. It's in a weird strip mall I wouldn't expect and the outdoor patio area could be nicer. Hannah was our server and she was timely and friendly. The sushi was way better than I anticipated; I thought it was weird this being a burger place but everything we had was bomb. Try the tiger roll! The fries are a must have. The drink menu is ok- they could have better options. Overall a good experience & their open late which is nice too!

Lvj68zifaLO-4eY3AJeXPQ.text: Although the food was good, the service was terrible.  My first visit was kinda disappointing however the server was very kind and redeemed herself and the restaurant by dismissing the cost of my meal.   I tried to really like this place however my 2nd and final visit was bad.  I had ordered a side of regular fries and was given them dead last after finishing the main dish 15 mins. ago.  I was first given mixed fries but had to wait another 7 mins for the right fries but lost my appetite by then.  Among other things,  my glass of water was empty and never got a refill.  If they improve, they may have something going for this place.

MUtEHv9YiclJ50jpv8ji7Q.text: Very good burgers and have came in quite often for their "reverse Happy Hour" from 11pm-2am. Always have a good drink list and a variety of beers on-Tap.  Have had a few servers not be the friendliest and is why I cannot give a 5/5 Stars.. Two different occasions in previous years have had unfriendly servers. If you don't like your job, find a new one! This establishment deserves the best help with their incredible menu.

XMZNbKCiO7Xs8eev4NSFqQ.text: Stopped in for lunch today and had a great experience!  The Delux Burger is delicious! Both the sweet potato and regular fries are fantastic.  Prices decent and service was great.  Love the bread for the burger.  Yum yum, can't wait to return

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rebydUKpgSDFCECkQyqgew.text: After the beet salad I had here recently, it was time to update this review.  I LOVE the fact that no matter how late it is, Delux seems to always be open (at least for an old person like me).   I LOVE the fact that the restaurant caters to different appetites. Feel like sushi? No prob. Feel like a hamburger from grass fed beef locally grown. No prob. Feel fat? No prob, order a tasty salad. You won't go wrong!  I LOVE the fact that the location is so convenient to home, and the parking lot is big enough to find a place to park.  I had my first Lindeman Framboise here. So, refreshing! There are a lot of beer options on tap, so you'll likely find something you like.   The beet salad was excellent and I'd definitely order it again. Full size, no prob. Just keep me away from those addictive fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lindeman framboise
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet salad--delicious!

Fe1pP1DNmIpH0yQvPhYezg.text: I enjoy this place. It's open until 2 so a night owl like me enjoys that. The crowd is diverse. The food is above average and the staff does well. I'll be back again to spend more money lol.

ySPIariW8LHUEEpB-wXKww.text: GREAT: 14 beers on tap! NOT GREAT: beer served warm.  When a reviewer goes on and on for paragraphs about the kind of "fusion" represented, that's a relatives or associates review you can bet.  Pointed info is the heart of YE_P!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just the inside of the main room. They also have 4 outside tables.

WzOiEqg-f1J40orgTSt4zg.text: My favorite place to eat when I am hungry at midnight!! They have a happy hour for sushi from 10-l to late night.. The place it's really cozy but it's really busy sometimes!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JEmlZtCg3grNfIRwShdUvA.text: I knew I shouldn't get sushi in the desert but I was really craving it and my friend told me there was good sushi in Scottsdale.  Well this isn't it.  I spent $40 on takeout sushi that would cost me $15 in (Washington) DC in a high end grocery. Maybe $25 in a restaurant.  Just to be clear - DC is not a cheap place, and sushi is not cheap food in DC.   Delux sushi tasted like grocery store sushi too.  Like crappy grocery store sushi. The crab meat was tasteless imitation crabmeat, the avocado was hard and unripe, the rice was stale, a lot of the fish was rubbery.. the spicy tuna was tasteless and not spicy.. etc. I could go on and on.  Finally the rolls were small. Sorry guys, but small rolls + crappy fish + stale rice + $$$$ is not a great formula for sushi.  I could understand either:  - big rolls + crappy food + $$$$  or - small rolls + decent food + $$$$  but not small rolls + crap + $$$$  (FWIW I ordered the rainbow roll and the tiger roll, as well as seaweed salad.)

ykhcVCa_xn4xVy79Zb6KIw.text: I really like this place! Since moving to Phoenix it's been hard to find late-nate sushi and I will drive to this place as they're open until 2 am and get my sushi-fixed be it alone or with friends. I haven't had too much of their non-sushi items, but the burger and fries were really good as well. Most nights the service is great and you will remember your waiter/waitress.

u4mOfHdT1IZQA6AjI06Tqw.text: The burger was good, but not delicious enough for 13+ dollars. Not sure I would go here again unless it's really late and nothing else was open.

_p5u8lESanS77rG8Cnrwyg.text: The best part about this restaurant is that they are open super late. I am a night owl so I love coming here for some late night sushi or the amazing Delux Burger. Also, make sure you get the sweet potato fries that they bring to you in a little shopping cart! The milk shake is amazing too made with real vanilla ice cream. They also have a chocolate lava dessert with fudge and vanilla ice cream which is really good. The sushi is pretty good too. They have REAL wasabi here which is not a creamy as regular wasabi but chopped up. It's really good. Check it out!

MlUJXfrnKuKaTyrmhq023A.text: My other half and I were in the Phoenix area and really craving burgers, so we decided to stop by here for a late lunch. First impressions were a bit strange - I'd never heard of a sushi/burger place, but we were willing to give it a try.   I had a few complaints, for example the restaurant itself was very dimly lit and rather dark, so I had to hold the menu closer to my face to be able to read it. The bathrooms were a bit of an atrocity as well - single-person bathrooms, with the sinks out in the hallway?! Even with just a couple people waiting in line and an employee restocking the paper towels it was very cramped and awkward to move around in that tiny little hallway, so unless or until they expand and revamp their facilities make sure you use the bathroom before you leave the house.  Moving on - we were seated in the sushi half of the restaurant because upon arriving we were undecided if we'd be ordering a roll or two, which we didn't, but on the television screens above the sushi bar they were playing my favorite anime, Shokugeki no Soma (Food Wars), which I got a huge kick out of! I'll admit, I had a small fan-girl moment. It was a shame they were playing it without audio or subtitles, since I would've really enjoyed to actually watch and listen to it, but it was still an interesting and nice surprise nonetheless.  As for our food, I ordered a grilled cheese panini, which at first didn't seem like it would be enough for a meal but it was actually very tasty and filling. My boyfriend ordered one of their signature burgers, which he let me have a few bites of, and it was equally delicious.  Now, here's the story of the day: We had ordered a basket of fries to split when we ordered our entrees, and our sandwiches had arrived first. Our waitress, who was rather young and slightly ditzy but polite and friendly, said the fries would be out shortly, which was fine - and sure enough just a few minutes later we could see in the little window between the kitchen and the restaurant was our fries sitting there waiting. But unfortunately, we never got those fries... as we were eating our sandwiches we watched multiple times as our waitress stopped by the window to chat with the chef, with our fries INCHES FROM HER FACE but she still left them there and never brought them to us. It wasn't until after we finished our entrees and we were sitting there a bit disappointed with our now-cold fries still in sight at the window, our waitress finally stopped and asked "Wait, did you guys ever get your fries?" Uh... as our server that should be something you would know?
