The beet salad is also very good. Order the Delux Burger! Chimay on tap, so this COULD get spendy folks.   This ain't McDonalds.   The place can get annoyingly crowded and loud. It is very popular. try to get an outside table if you can.

cMyxASqpzCp-2YNgwAigmg.text: Who wants to eat a greasy bland burger with a thick bun (doubles the meat) with fries and pay $15.00 for it? If you said yes, then Delux is the place for you.   The only reason why I even gave it 3 stars was because it's one of few restaurants that is open until 2:00 AM and the interior is nicely decorated. It actually looked like a fun place to grab drinks but not the burgers. After reading reviews about Delux, I was excited to try a "gourmet" burger. Instead, I ended up with their "Delux" burger, which the meat was tasteless and overly greasy by itself. The burger was minimally saved by some of the savory toppings like grilled onions. The bun was grilled (drenched) with butter. We actually split the burger and fries and boy was I glad!   The day after my burger experience, my stomach reminded me that Delux is just not the place for me.

fRt9JloRBxhr7hWQyxstmQ.text: I can't believe I've failed to review this place! In fact, I'm not sure why I don't go more often. Had a nice lunch today, the burger at medium rare was super juicy and the fries were solid. I had a really nice bloody mary and the $3 price tag was nice. I want to stray away from the burgers and try some sandwiches next time... plus the wall o' draft beers is drool inducing.

8zwZNT9MWIqDRGfpTNRpvw.text: Love it!  I work nearby and it is always a struggle not to go there for lunch or after work.  Be warned, unless you go off hours be prepared to wait.  But they are open late so it is a good place to stop for a late dinner or drink.  Try the Delux Burger...medium rare...it's juicy and cheezy delicousness.  Skip the regular fries and go for the Sweet Potato fries.  They have the perfect balance of sweet and salty and excellent aioli for dipping.  There is a large beer list and the salads are huge and perfect for sharing if you want to go green.  All in all, a great place to grab a excellent burger and cold beer.

GEaj9G-GCUz9eybJtR-8EA.text: I've been here probably five times now and this place is amazing. Their burgers got voted best in Arizona for a reason! I love their food, and the great thing is the sushi is really great too! You'd think burgers and sushi would be an odd combo but they make it amazing :) I definitely recommend this place for anyone! The shopping cart fries are the cutest ^-^

9jiIEweWQyrcSWiFwDRz9A.text: This is my all time favorite burger place.  Very high quality in every aspect of the food.  Full bar and great beer menu too.  Plus they're open late.

TUPPtoDsOPvPI4ROqP6ygw.text: Ever since they started selling sushi at this restaurant it really smells inside. My wife and I will get the food to go or eat on the patio because the fish smell is so bad inside the restaurant. Also, why does a side of fries cost $6 when it should be included with a $12 burger.

IFxvdQDygK3Y8vtk_4ZVIg.text: I've been going to deluxe for years and have never left a review because it's pretty much all been said with 500+ reviews. But, I think it's time...  Burgers are awesome! Always have been. The deluxe burger is great if you want something different. Extremely rich and delicious. The classic is good if you are more of a ketchup and mustard kinda burger eater. It was always too much food for me so I was sooo happy to see the addition of the mini burgers, woohoo.  And...you can just buy one if that's all you want. I wish they had the deluxe burger available in mini too.  As a frequent take out person, I was sorry to see the 2 go side slowly disappear. Now you have to walk in through the middle of diners eating and it's a little awkward. Then the to go counter completely disappeared and was replaced by a sushi bar. This I think is weird. If you want to do sushi, do it in another spot. You are trying to squeeze too much under one roof.   Also, my last take out order had extremely soggy sweet potato fries. They were cold, floppy and inedible. I didn't take away a star for this because it's the first time it happened. But, come on. Every drive through in town can provide warm crispy fries...so can you. They are amazing when done right!  Go here if you want a great burger and fries. The root beer and beet salad are also very good.

ihTc7I7oa7Aw9KMbnjgNWQ.text: FYI, it's bad luck to have chopsticks sticking up in a bowl. Re: Chinese chicken salad  Anyways, the burgers are not what they once were, or my tastebuds have greatly evolved.  Mine was no good, no good at all, if i were not so hungry i would have sent it back. Yeah, that bad.  The fries were good though!

Y6pA4IjqOo4ZL8JFLF8N2A.text: Burger, the best. Fries. Just ok.  Get a chocolate chip cookie on the way out. They are like butter.

r458KVSs7XHOj9Ogkdormg.text: Dope spot! Love going too this place for a late night bite too eat....sushi happy hour for sure! Plus the vibe is trendy but not at the same time idk ! This is place is definitely somewhere too check out when it's past 10 every night of the week. And try too find James he's the man always on top of everything super friendly and very professional even at times of distress.....furthermore this place isn't that type of corporate establishment either... Thanks deuces!

jRiM-YM9tkyEaylLiDFt6w.text: I got to the airport nice and early the other day and was delighted to see that delux was serving breakfast. It sounded delicious... the perfect sandwich. One of their yummy buns with two eggs, bacon and sausage. Heck yeah.  Unfortunatly it wasn't near as good as it looked and sounded. Eggs had been cooked a while ago and were a bit dry and the bun wasn't the yummy soft, fresh bun it should have been.  Fries were great. Maybe the burgers are better.

LhjpIHVnV9Idd7IKn4A8Ag.text: Delux has the best burger. no doubt in my mind (and there are many good burgers around).  However, I always order the same item when I come.  I always get the Delux burger exactly how they recommend it cooked.  Their prices are a little bit higher, but it is worth it for what I feel is the best burger.  The fries are excellent, great with the sauce, and the atmosphere is trendy and unexpected for a burger place.  I like that sushi is on their menu (for variety), but I haven't tried it.

waiWpi-c0-Pfjp34k4JiHQ.text: Not much in to burgers. But this place burgers are truly 5 stars. Very professional customer service,  clean place, and very modern. I will be back for sure :)

jIRvZxut6nQI6FjwJMyuTg.text: Always slow and rude staff I've had multiple terrible experiences here. If it's late and you want food go next door to Mexx32 it's 1000x times better

FSve_yHgu_5UBPQuXPwB6Q.text: I've been going there for years.  The place is small but the atmosphere and service make up for it. Fries served in a mini shopping cart. Good option for non burger eaters. The grilled cheese is pretty good.  Tip: Order your burger a step more done than you normally would.

ZAKA_Zfny44KX6FBvTrPWA.text: Delux Burger is way over rated. And here I thought I was missing out on something. The only reason I am giving this 2 stars is because our service was good (Brandon). I ordered their signature Delux Burger. Uh no. As someone else's comment stated, there really was no taste, the roll was soggy with blood (I requested medium and then sent it back to cook more) and now that I think about it there was nothing more on my burger than lettuce. The sweet potato fries: ok. Hard to mess them up.  "Good classic burger"? Not at all.

4WAr5CTHJwa94w98ZtHs_w.text: Legit.  Love the decor, great service, fresh ingredients and clever layout.  I had the signature burger and a flite of three beers.  We got a few sushi rolls, and it's easily the best sushi I've had in Arizona.  The fries came out in a freaking tiny shopping cart - AND they came with fry sauce!  For a fat kid who grew up in Idaho / Utah, this is an absolute staple when it comes to fry consumption.  The only reason this place doesn't get a 5th star is, the signature burger, while tasty, came out with a grease soaked bottom bun.  This leads to the sog-factor, which is a texture I find intolerable in the burger kingdom.  I'm sure it's not easy to make a burger patty WITH bacon mixed in non-soggy, but maybe a grilled bun, or some lettuce under the patty would help with this.  Either way, I will be back, and look forward to it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed fries with FRY SAUCE!  So good.  And, gotta admit the freaking shopping cart really amused me.

_HJOHQVMw9YfrqfTHfvkwQ.text: I've been obsessed with this place since my first visit and return anytime I'm craving a big, juicy burger.  My go-to is the classic burger, medium-rare, with a slice of cheddar and crispy bacon. It's always cooked to perfection, juicy and delicious. You really can taste the quality of the Neiman Ranch meat (burger & bacon). What really sets this place apart, however, is the fries & aoli. They say the fries are for sharing but my boyfriend and I always require 2 baskets and extra aoli. Both the regular and the sweet potato are to die for! Great beer selection too, really what more could you want than good beer, fries, and burgers??

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Juicy, medium-rare burger..delish!
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fLA8ZiPPcsLCGTQz-SNLTA.text: This is a very delicious burger joint. They sell sushi as well which is just as good. The decor is wonderful and the service is great too! Great place for a burger!

KGZP-e5eXThUqTjvDYy3Zw.text: Disappointed.  Used to love this place. Tonight didn't seem busy at all but had horrible service. Hardly got my water refilled (just after I paid), very bland turkey burger and ordered a beer I never received.  A shame,  used to be my go to place. Will now be going to Carl's Jr instead

_Q9A2XwDDMQmBYHJHe1r9g.text: Great food and service. Amazing food selection. Awesome beer specials.   i have tried the Grilled Cheese & Turkey Burgers and both were amazing. SWEET POTATO FRIES! To die for!  Don't skip this place, :)

pEhyZfj1kfll5-yx--qN7w.text: Possibly the best burger I have ever had.  Check Yelp for a good burger place and Delux looked best. Ordered a burger and on that first bite you always wonder what it will be like. So bit in hopefully and... It was the most amazing taste. I swear I heard angels sing. The burger was absolute heaven.  My wife had a panini and said it was very good.  The fries were so-so.  Giant selection of beer. Got a couple of samples and then had a new one (Green River Street something) that was really good. The selection is really varied so you should definitely find one you'll like.  Really nice seating & decor.

x1g8UF9PcGMD6_cg9cphCA.text: So this place really had the potential of being better but I think I miust have just gone on an off day. Unfortunately probably won;t be back in AZ for a while so they may never redeem themselves in my book!  We went for the beers and burgers and beet salad I had read so much about. First off, when we order the waiter tells us the fan is out for the night so theres no beer AT ALL.... they advertise their beer and burgers like crazy- you'd think there was a sign or someone would tell us before we were seated!  Anyways, the beet salad I got was very good. The beets and walnuts and arugula and all that jazz were crispy and refreshing and the dressing they use is very subtle so you can really enjoy those veggies. Also had the low-carb roll... it was good, but nothing special- served me right for ordering sushi at a burger joint. My boyfriend got the Delux burger. he LOVED it. the bun, the burger, the toppings- all of it was right up his alley and no wonder their burgers have been rated the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet salad
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bartender special!

He9aKbZ2XFuj8dzgA56sjA.text: Great burger but I happen to love blue cheese.  Their panini's are awesome and even though I am not a vegetarian I still adore the veggie panini.   Sweet potato fries are amazing here.  especially with the aioli sauce. Bartenders remember me and the managers always come over to say Hi and make sure everything was alright. Love the candles everywhere cuz who doesn't look great in dim lighting?! Bathroom is always super clean and it's retro look is neat.  Some of the patrons can be a little stuffy but they are easily ignored.

XLoDvwCsqXtuDybPsVC95A.text: Why doesn't Delux offer a veggie burger? Come on Delux! I would give you 5 stars if you would!   Anyway, I'll settle for the beet salad which is huge, delicious and healthy.   The sweet potato fries are pretty good too, especially with the sauce they serve with it.   Service is always very friendly. Great location too!

N4L3dmrajpB_hIErT3uVsg.text: You may have to wait for clearly some of the best burgers in AZ..or the west for that matter.. I dont really eat red meat, but every now and then..if worth it..I will shock my system.. Go ahead and cheat with the fries..they come in a cutesy shopping cart with aioli.. do it! My buddy had a burger....all engrossed with cheese and bun and sauce..I had to try it...it was orgasmic! BUT I love me some asian salad..and I ordered that after I inquired as to what it was earlier as it was delivered to the table next to me... IT is a huge salad.. huge!!! Yummy thai peanut dressing and another dressing on the spicier side comes with too... We sat in the middle..the long counter with blue lights.... we were seated on the patio..but the drip system...well, was drippy! So they happily moved us.. martinis and wine ... very good...staff very nice and accomodating..He even gave us a sweet little discount..I wont say why.., but he liked us.:-) ;-) .. but we gave it back in tip... My guy friend got a dessert next door...@Delux to go... looked yum...but I dont have the metabolism of a guy so I choose to not....

C9HKatR0IqtSzJgdbM9RgA.text: On one of my Scottsdale excursions recently i got taken to Delux by a friend who said they make, "the best burger she has ever had." So obviously i had to put this to the test.We started with sweet potato fries which were served in a mini shopping cart which was entertaining. They were cooked to crisp perfection and lightly seasoned and still had the incredible sweet potato taste. I got to try the clasic delux burger itself and it was quite amazing, incredibly juicy and cooked just how i like it. We also got the lightly seasoned original fries as well which were just as good as the sweet potato ones. i also got to try the turkey burger which was also juicy and flavorful, along with the chicken panini which was incredibly tasty.  it was a great lunch every one i was with enjoyed themselves and I am glad my friend recommended it.

T8mqUdrbxO8BZD4-biT2gw.text: Delux is always really good, fresh, and it's a clean place too! I love the beet salad with chicken added. It's delish! My man digs the burgers and we both scarf the sweet potato fries. Love their dipping sauce that comes next to the ketchup, Ah-mazing!

HOJ0e38iw656QSUFDKQF2g.text: The burgers are fantastic! the sweet potato fries are my favorite! wonderful patio seating! however, my burger is never prepared the way I originally ask that's always a downer and disappointing however if you like your burger well done ask for VERY well done they like to cook them rare.    Open until 2am everyday of the week so that alone keeps me coming back.

Bm2tQdbtZtBAhynEFRQK3w.text: I used to love it here. For years it was the best burger in town. But, I have to say the last couple times we've been here I've been really disappointed. The burger is BLAND now. I have to take this place off the list, too bad. Houston's/Hillstone burger has never disappointed, so we'll be going there from now on.

5NdlgEvt5jgKssa7dQtfjA.text: The atmosphere is great, its very metro decorated.. very modern, which I like.    The food was good, I had a cheeseburger, the sweet potato fries are absolutely fabulous..   And the staff was really attentive and very nice.  I def recommend it.

tHVEZjduCBw0qUmtfp-z1A.text: After a long awaited trip to Delux I was soooo disappointed.  Had only read great reviews about the wonderful burgers....well maybe they are but not on my visit.  Terrible service.  Cold burger (my melted cheese had hardened), soggy bun.  Don't think we will return anytime soon if at all.

ports3VvN-y-jJckEt1_eA.text: Delux perhaps defined the entire summer I spent in Phoenix. I have only fond memories of this place.  Hip: let's get this out of the way first. Yes, from the blue and black lights in funky round balls atop the bar to the center table with stools to the booths along the side, the interior oozes of cool. I am particularly picky about where I sit in restaurants, but I tried pretty much every seat in the house here and I will say they're all great for whatever matches your mood. The place is small inside, and there's sometimes waits during peak hours/weekends.   The hours. This is what really made Delux...well, deluxe for me. It's open so late, and I loved coming here for a more mellow nightcap on weekends. The drink list is superb (essentially, the food consists of one page and the drinks are the other 7 pages of the menu) and I always found the bartender to prepare our drinks well and quickly.  Now, the food. Burgers. Are. Delicious. They are basically your high class, uber-chic and swanky burgers with impeccable presentation. I was impressed. I must say I'm sold on not only the image but also the taste. The perfect ratio of protein-carb-toppings. I would highly suggest pretty much any of their burgers, but start with their Delux Burger. It's the staple. As for the sides, yes, the fries (sweet potato AND regular) are tasty and adorable, coming in this little shopping cart, which makes it perfect to share. They are, likewise, delicious. Also, they don't make you feel like you need to go run a marathon or your heart might give out on you, so that was always a huge incentive for me to indulge.  Service has always been good here on the whole. Sometimes, naturally, during the busy times it can get a little slow and you can feel slightly neglected, but hopefully your company and/or the food will ease the pain.  I miss Delux. A LOT. I am also dying to try their cupcakes, which weren't part of the menu when I was last there...

lvw1-fQ0r5NYlDaAYUXKiw.text: Cool, hip and happening ... sure. I was impressed when my friend took me here after noticing how I pay attention to good places to dine. We were in hamburger mode and Delux was just what we were looking for.  The atmosphere was trendy, busy but not packed and overall had a good vibe. We sat in the outside patio area after a short 20 min wait on a Friday night. I immediately liked the place just on their drinks menu. I really appreciated the fact that they are descriptive about their drink selections. Nice touch indeed.  So I got the turkey burger and it was pretty good even though I wasn't digging the bun too much. We got a mix portion of the sweet and regular potato fries in what seems to be their signature container - the mini shopping cart. Overall the food was above average and worthy of high praise.  I plan to visit the Phoenix area from time to time and I certainly will need a repeat visit to Delux. They were just that good!

5S_pBZv1V0rLQWFafnLzAA.text: So, after hearing about Delux from co-workers and Yelp, I had to try it.  Getting there early helps, because the restaurant gets packed quickly.   First off, the place is ultra chic. A large bar/table is in the center of the restaurant, highlighted with blue lights. This place oozes of sleek.  But enough about the lighting, onto the food!  I got the Delux burger, which was incredible. Medium rare beef, served up on arugula with gruyere and a mixture of onions and bacon was incredible. The bun, a super soft baguette style was incredible as well.   Juice dripped from this burger. Not grease, but juice.  Pure, delicious, incredible, beef juice. If I could bottle and sell it, I would.  My fiance had the turkey burger, which was excellently spiced, a tad dry, but the aioli helped cover that dryness.  Their fries were also tasty, I enjoyed the ketchup and aioli. However, I have had better sweet potato fries.  Their beer selection is awesome, including selections from 4 Peaks, I had an excellent Kolsch-style lager, that complemented my burger well.  The prices are a little high, but the burger does make it worth it, both size and quality  On a final note,I wouldn't recommend coming here at night, it seems like over priced drinks, loud music, and lots of stuck up people.

M2Qk4RckU048YBbEJooiPA.text: Any review of Delux requires an obligatory mention of the Los Angeles landmark restaurant Father's Office, whose concept was all but completely plagiarized by Delux. I always say, though, it doesn't matter who came up with the idea, it matters who executes it. And, I like how Delux executes the concept. High-end burgers, delicious craft beer selection and great service in a cozy (and hip) location.  Of course, I have to be the weirdo -- I am also a vegetarian, so I can't have a burger anyway. Instead, I grabbed the amazing grilled cheese, which they grill panini-style, cut into quadrants. The baguette, as usual, was perfectly toasty, firm, yet chewy. There is a great variety of craft beers -- everything from Alaskan Amber to Stone IPA. The service is always good, although this time our server was particularly flirty. He actually sat down with my dining companions and I to chit chat. It was charming and fun and certainly added to the fun (and enjoyment) of the meal.  Another mandatory purchase at Delux is the fries -- available in sweet potato, regular, or half and half. The fries are served in a mini shopping cart (familiar to anyone who has been to Father's Office). They are perfectly seasoned and served with a delicious aioli dipping sauce.  Delux is a perfect place to have a sandwich and day drink on a warm afternoon, and I am looking forward to the temperature cooling off so I can waste a few Sundays there. And, of course, Delux is open till 2 a.m., so it is a great option for late nights as well.

jUKxBjXPK5pB2jbgcEgBLw.text: Funny thing about Phoenix: you never know where you can find a decent bite to eat.  Every year my buddies and I head down for a long weekend of Spring Training and lap dances. This year I decided I'd do some research on restaurants, as we'd been disappointed way too often.  After a long night at the Candy Store we headed to Delux. I was a little nervous about the strip mall location, but then I remembered "this is Phoenix."  We showed up around 11:30 on a Sunday night. The place was packed, but they had a seat for us. The burger was awesome, only overshadowed by the incredible shopping cart of fries.

QIf9R5az2JAe_CoNCKKXtA.text: If you like cow, you need to go to Delux.  They have the best burgers!  They even have a turkey burger if you are so inclined.    I always go with the Standard Classic Burger, cheddar, extra pickles.  Love it!  One thing to watch out for though - the last time I was there I asked for my burger medium and my dining partner ordered medium rare.  The burgers came out more like well done and medium well.  If this type of thing matters to you, stress to your waitress that you really do want it cooked the way you say you do.  Then again, it could have been an off night.  I love their sweet potato fries - a guilty pleasure that's also good for you.  Delux has a great beer selection too and I've found that the beer flights are the way to go.  The servings are generous and you get to try a few before committing to one.  For those who fear commitment, this is the place to be.  I've never made it to desert so I can't comment.  Finally, try to get there early or late, ahead or behind the crowd.  Delux is always busy at lunch and dinner time and I've almost always had to wait.

0hi-2rBzchrA331V72_DPQ.text: Delux rocks. Good service, a full bar, great menu and its open late! if your feel'n not so much like a burger, get the Chinese Chicken Salad or the Grilled Cheese!   ........And don't forget about the root beer on tap!

C6dAy46bvj8r9Woabju4XA.text: We were SO hung over from visiting a friend in Scottsdale last week and he recommended a nice burger from Delux.    We met up with him and the place was pretty cool looking.  We sat at the long row table which I would have rather sat down in a chair or booth since I could feel the alcohol seeping from my skin.    I really wanted to curl up in a ball and die but needed some food first.   We were starving and got the delux burger with mix of sweet potato fries (served in a cute cart!).  None of us could finish the burger it was so filling and delicious!  I also had the gaspacho soup which was refreshing to begin with.   I didn't give this five stars though because the atmosphere to me wasn't very comfortable and a bit overpriced.

kTFzmbg8meyF9PbBr22iUQ.text: I've been here twice and disappointed both times.  The delux burger is bland yet incredibly salty.  The toppings are sparse.  The meat is good quality.  For the high price, you can do much better elsewhere.

dYBhNdL5BrYDvNWApV1ofA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in the Valley! The service here is always excellent, no matter who our waiter is. The food is very high quality. I often find myself here for an impromptu girl's night out, and the ambiance is just fantastic. Plus, they're open late, which is great for those late night cravings! I crave their French fries probably three times a week, they are THAT good. And the aioli sauce that they serve with the fries tastes so amazing, I have never been able to find another aioli even remotely close to being as good as that. Great ... now I'm craving them again! :)

3GOk4Zs-o4NrZXywEU1nLQ.text: Delux seemed a little yuppie for me, but we tried it anyways after my friend kept raving about it. I got the original Delux burger with the caramelized onions and whatnot on it. I liked the soft baguette it came on; but at the same time when I want a burger I want a BURGER, you know? So one of those oversized buns would have been better, I think. We shared an order of the sweet potato and regular fries, which were good with that aoili dip that comes with it. They were crispy and thin cut, which I liked.   I was disappointed with their small selection of burgers. I like variety. But they did offer salads (the chinese chicken salad, by the way, is great) and I think a few other items. On the plus side, they're open to 2am... and they have cool bathrooms if that counts for anything.

m_FA9KvFrNQTUZTOPQ4jTg.text: Excellent burger place! The music was interesting and the patio was beautiful. Little slow waiter and someone was smoking right by the patio.... Overall good experience!

veGsNwCwTRuFwNfu6h00Ug.text: Faded Glory. We used to live nearby, and so qualified as regulars.  They deserved their reputation then, but now I'm afraid that they're living off of it. Disinterested server, no water refills, and we waited and waited after ordering.  When we looked back toward the kitchen, there must have been twenty plates waiting to be served, with the manager standing there, and no servers!  And my burger was overdone (they tend to do that if you order anything beyond rare).  And my wife described her sushi as bland. Too many other choices to bother with this one.

8EnNyLu51-DKxr_1ivLTTQ.text: We came in tonight around 530, they were pretty full but were seated right away. We sat in Jacquelines station and she got our drinks right away and Mom ordered a beet salad that was very, very good. Lots of beet strings and candied pecans. The dressing was a tad heavy and blue cheese was powerful but that salad was awesome nonetheless. I had the Delux burger with caramelized onions, cheese, arugula and perfectly cooked patty on a roll. I thought it was fantastic. We got the mixed fries on the side and it was a healthy portion with a fry sauce and ketchup on the side. Service was great, food was great....what more can you ask for? I can't believe it's my 1st time here but definitely not my last.

kl9xRb8Njd9bhc2SO5b0Vg.text: Spent my 2015 New Year's here, and I don't have any complaints!  Walking in, I was taken by the trendy lighting and decor along with cozy booths that make the place feel intimate despite the open design.  Quick and attentive service was consistent during our whole meal.  Our party ordered the Bruschetta as a starter and a Delux Basket of Mixed Fries to share. The Bruschetta was wonderful; crispy baguette slices topped with perfectly textured tomatoes. I could have eaten just that for dinner and been happy. The Mixed Fries were good - I was especially surprised that the sweet potato fries were crispy. The accompanying housemade sauce was delicious.  For our main eats we ordered The Classic and Delux Burgers. Our pescetarian friend ordered a California Roll, Shrimp Tempura, and Spicy Tuna.  My burger (the Delux) was delicious. The burger had a nice, perfectly seasoned flavor, and a good amount of chew texture-wise. I especially enjoyed the caramelized onions and applewood bacon that top the Delux Burger. If I'm ever in Phoenix again I'd order another for sure.  Two of use decided to ring in the New Year with Deluxtinis. If you're looking for something that is sweet and packs a roundhouse kick to the senses, get the Deluxtini.  Orange flavored vodka, peach schnapps, pineapple juice, and champagne are all mixed up and served to you in a classic martini glass. This drink is STRONG, and if you don't enjoy the taste of vodka it might be off-putting; if you are into drinks that aren't too sweet but have a lot of fruity flavor I'd recommend the Deluxtini.  All in all, Delux left a great impression on me. The food was good, and we had great service. If I lived in the area, it'd be a regular happy hour spot as they have not one, but two!

xn21bqIoFCoQUTjmU15iMA.text: Rat infested kitchen Lenny doesn't care to fix it. Overpriced hamburgers and crooked owner. I came in a saw a rat running across the floor after trying Delux for the first time after getting a coupon from Mexx 32 which is now closed needless to say I wont be back. The staff is extremely friendly.

EtTedqAvBgC9K80dCM4rig.text: Saw this place advertised on MSN.com as the best burger spot on Arizona so I gave it a tried and yes it was delicious. I got the Delux Burger and the classic burger, of them both I recommend the classic. The fries come in a super market cart which is makes it unique.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Delux Burger

pfc_c1kBpwzZ4dHUk-G-IQ.text: Ordered burgers and fries carry out yesterday.   As the person is checking my order at the back counter she drops a bag of my fries onto the floor and proceeds to pick it up off the floor and put it into my to go bag !  Fortunately I happened to be watching and made her take them out and have a new order cooked for me.  Amazingly she did not throw the dropped bag of fries away but left them by the other waiting to go orders.  Hopefully she did not give them to another unsuspecting carry out customer.   I'll never go back to this restaurant.

5bpoEEO-s0bqo5e-Quqobg.text: Most of the staff are excellent. The food is always great! I usually get the beet salad but I it would be nice to see a few more salad options. The passion tea is really good too and the fries are amazing of course!

wPI0lbChwjXCKpG04zoIdw.text: Great burger! The classic cheeseburger is great! Fresh buns, tender juicy meat and fries are great!  Milkshakes are delicious too!

Dz2PCQc0szr6OWCnmqviQg.text: The burgers at this place are AMAZING! They are big, cooked to perfection, and extremely tasty. The fries are delivered in a cute little shopping basket The service is friendly and the atmosphere is pleasant. This is definitely a place you want to visit. It also is open late night with a full bar; that's certainly a plus!

ipeYpGF-leJSjNRdJtL5Rg.text: Outstanding sweet potato fries. The burger is served on a baguette roll rather than your traditional hamburger bun. They say their beef is sourced directly from Niman Ranch, and although I can't say I understand the significance of that, the beef patty at Delux is one of the most flavorful, and juicy patty that I've had. There's lots of parking available and it is conveniently located in Biltmore near all the business centers.

ZbRR7UddPljcJXeShN-9Zw.text: Came here when we visited family from Arizona! They decided to take us here bc it was good. It was a far drive though.. Everything seems to be so far away from each other compared to California. Anyways onto the food:   Chocolate milkshake- my bf ordered this and it was so thick and creamy! It was absolutely delicious and is a total must!  Deluxe burger- I switched out the bleu cheese for Swiss. The baguette bread was so soft and just the way I like it. The meat was so juicy and tender (I had it in medium rare).  Regular and sweet potato fries- it came out in little carts and was so cute! I like the regular fries more tho Vegas roll- my little cousin ordered this and we should've known better than to order sushi at a burger joint.... It wasn't good and got very old easily. She didn't even finish it.  California hand roll- she enjoyed this, but how can anyone mess up such a simple entree.  Classic burger- bf loved it and seemed happy with his choice  Decor Very trendy place! I'm not use to a burger joint being so hipster. Looked more like a bar for me. It was pretty cool though!  It was a bit on the expensive side for burgers. I don't usually eat burgers so maybe that's why? For 3 people, it was $66-76 excluding tip.

itvJkg1IQBOEj8n41oQ0qQ.text: The Delux burger lunch special with mixed fries is amazing! Special runs from 11:00-4:00 pm 7 days a week.

JhQU5PjbACxHNsC7zDl5JA.text: I first came here several years ago before I was a yelper. The delux burger haunted my dreams as the best burger I've maybe ever had. Since then, I've had many high end burgers, so I was thinking, it's probably not as good as I remember and I've built it up in my mind. Nope! It's still awesome and totally lived up to the anticipation. So what makes the Delux Burger so great, well it starts off with very high grade Niman Ranch Beef. You want this burger to be nice and pink so order it medium rare. It's such a juicy burger that the beef itself creates a sauce that is soaked into what they call a demi baguette. This is a perfect bun. It's shaped like a mini sub roll and the burger is also rectangular so you have burger covering every inch of the roll. You would expect something called a baguette to be crunchy on the outside, but this isn't. It's nice and soft, yet firm enough not to fall apart. The cheese on this burger is an interesting mix of may tag bleu cheese and gruyere. I felt on this visit, there could have been a little more cheese, so next time I'm ordering extra chese for sure. The burger is also topped with a blend of caramelized onions and chopped up smoked applewood bacon. The only veggie is baby arugula. It is perhaps tossed in a little olive oil first, but I'm not sure. You don't add on or take off from this burger, as it's perfection. They brought some ketchup and mayo but it takes away from the flavor. The juices from the beef along with the caramelized onion bacon mixture makes sure the burger is in no way dry. yelp.com/biz_photos/delu... Now if you live in Los Angeles, this burger may be familiar to you. It's called the Father's Office Burger. And truthfully Delux Burger ripped it off. But this is better hands down. I've had a few father's office burgers in between my first and last Delux Burger and it's not even close. They have perfected it here. They even stole the A La Carte Fries idea served in a little mini shopping cart. But let's just call it an homage, because the fries are way better at Delux too. We got the mixed sweet potato and regular fries. Perfectly seasoned, crispy, but still potatoey. I'm not sure which I liked better, so I love that you can get a mix. yelp.com/biz_photos/delu... Got to try a few other things as well such as the Brie and Mushroom Soup. While it didn't have gooey strands of brie (man I was hoping for that) it was more like a very rich cream of mushroom soup. Very good. They have a different soup each day, so if you want this one you have to come on Thursdays. yelp.com/biz_photos/delu... I was so full it was hard to get dessert, but I'm so glad I did. The apple pie was very homemade tasting, piping hot topped with Haagen Dazs Vanilla Ice Cream. We loved every bite of it. yelp.com/biz_photos/delu... I wish I lived near Delux as I'd love to try some other things on their menu. They now have a Sushi bar as well, but I have no idea how it is. The vibe of the place is great and they have the kind of bathroom you wished you had in your house. The attention to detail at Delux doesn't go unnoticed and it was great to see that they are still at the top of their game. Another plus is they are open until 2am with a full bar!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Pie a la mode with Haagen Dazs Vanilla Ice Cream.
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed Sweet Potato and Regular Fries &#34;A La Carte&#34;
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Delux Burger.  Don&#39;t make any changes, just order as is medium rare.

Dxw04rlFKIWLAlFCw3qxBQ.text: The service was very fast and friendly. 40 diverse craft beers on tap. The delux burger is amazing and huge! The fries are so delicious and they come in cute mini shipping carts. Overall a 10. I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delux burger with the mixed full order of fries...so good!

vJczorhS-i0Gl_VBISE1jA.text: Absolutely love their burgers!! They also have this amazing bucket of mixed fries with spicy aioli!

Tl4s4u7VlpZjG5U-erTf2w.text: I have been coming to Delux for years.  Lots and lots of pros.  First, the Chinese Chicken Salad is amazing.  Probably my favorite on the menu.  Secod, the beer selection is great -- they often have Orange Blossom which I really enjoy (it pairs especially nice with the salad!) Third, the basket of French fries are also great - I prefer the mix basket. Finally, they are open late for food!  This is a super pro.  At times I get stuck at work past 10pm and know I can always still get food here.

7KL6A9D0rASuGC33BSP5Tw.text: Will recommend this place to anybody that is a big burger fanatic!!! The patty here has to be the best I've had. So good. The fries are also awesome with the aoli sauce. Best burgers in Arizona !!!! Also had the Chinese chicken salad and it was delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delux duo, and hot dog for me!!!

MMKdFYKsR49Um0zEyfRJPA.text: Burger joints have been popping up everywhere making a good hamburger harder to find. This place is way over priced for just a basic burger ($12) with no sides. My boyfriend got their specialty and it was nothing too fantastic. I got the tuna and the bread overpowered the rest of the sandwiches. We shared the fries basket and had two sodas with a $39 total. Way too much to spend on a burger and fries in my opinion! I saw they had a sushi bar which just seemed out of place. I'm not sure this place knows exactly what they want to be either.

aV5Ve2h02M-_EfTr9VpL0g.text: Delicious! This burger hit the spot. I ordered the classic with American cheese and bacon; he had the Delux burger with caramelized onions plus bacon chopped into that, topped off with pepper jack cheese. The meat was prepared as I desired; very good beef from Niman Ranch. Fries were perfect; we shared a mix of regular and sweet. To top it off: chocolate malt! Next time through town we'll definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate malt!
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My burger: the classic with American cheese and slices of bacon.
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The tasty fries were delivered in this cute shopping basket.

zNfkSyBOmUB5JBt4JTv7fQ.text: Love their burgers!  I usually get the classic burger with avocado.  Great service every time we go! We like eating outside and they always turn the heaters on.  Plus their sweet potato fries are the Amazing! My husband loves the regular fries in the shopping cart.

0h_FVilgoV4nZC7BckjJOA.text: Fire. Just straight gas. Come here for top shelf sushi and burgers, they will plug you tf up. Nice bathrooms as well.

mlu3Og2xmC7Az27ZwsJ0FQ.text: I have been going to Delux since it opened 15 years ago.    About 4 months we visited the restaurant and sat on the patio.  We sat, sat some more and then some more ... All while other people around us were being served (mind you they sat down AFTER us) ... servers just kept on walking past us ...   We walked out and went to The Vig Uptown - they don't have the burgers Delux has, but hey - at least we got served.    We then decided to try Delux again this past weekend (8/11).  Same thing happened!  Sat on the patio, the owner even greeted us, other people sat down after us and were served and greeted before us.  We walked out and went to Zinburger at the Biltmore - they don't have the burgers Delux has, but hey - at least we got served ...

mO-IEjABJSu6tHW-txJSCA.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet! I live around the corner! I eat here all the time! Delux I'm so sorry I neglected to give you props until now! If you love burgers, sushi and craft beer look no further. They're all perfect. What we love the most is being able to go for sushi and get fries on the side. Or go for a burger and also have a sushi roll. It's like a dream. A yummy burgery sushi beery fantasy. They do all of it exactly right. They have sushi happy hour. They stay open late which is a rarity in Phoenix. They have cocktails. There's plenty of parking. They do take out. They do lettuce wraps. The lighting is perfect. The service is fast and friendly. The prices are right. It's so good I'm getting a little choked up just thinking about the meal I had only yesterday. Tito, get me some tissue. Jermaine stop teasing.

uptbNP2zxOmMP2Sr9RGtaA.text: Lighting is actually nice! I tried 4-5 sushi rolls, they were all high quality and tasted nice! Server which was a cute blonde(Hannah) was really helpful with choosing appetizers when we needed help and some feedback about the food. It's a small restaurant so hard to find tables but that shouldn't be a problem if you don't mind waiting for a little bit!

Qwl6ZQ7VEF4dM2TEyTdYVw.text: Best burger in town & great atmosphere!!  The owner Lenny came and greated us at our table when we were here. He made sure we had a great experience..something that is hard to find these days.  He truly has a passion for this restaurant.    The beef on his burgers comes from a small farm in northern Cali and is free of all the crap that comes from factory beef... and it tastes amazing!! The sweet potato fries and regular fries are very tasty too.  We also got the Kale chop salad, which was also amazing.  The atmosphere is very cozy here too, not loud, not too upscale, not to busy...just perfect.  I love all the booths too.  We will be coming back!

2OCqKArj1XPUC1Fk2wJUEA.text: One of the most important things to me when it comes to a restaurant is he atmosphere. Deluxe has atmosphere in spades. it's always a happening place to be whether it's the afternoon or 1 a. M. yet at the same time it's never too crowded and too loud. The food is incredible the prices are great and the staff is awesome. I'm not a sushi guy so I usually get the hot dog on the pretzel bun and it's awesome. The fresh baked cookies and the real Coco chocolate cake are absolutely delicious. The french fries served in the little shopping carts are awesome as well. 5/5 definitely a cool place to bring people visiting Phoenix or a group of friends.

i3gYT_kNxlHlSIJnLN_rZA.text: I think most people like this place because it's a novelty to find a restaurant that serves both burgers and sushi. The food was good, not great - we had a turkey burger and a classic. Both tasty, however, we've definitely had better burgers in the same price range. Rehab Burger and Zinburger both have better burgers, and you'd get fries for the same price that Delux offers burger only at. We also tried the sushi, which was good but again nothing that you can't get elsewhere for the same price.

lYYzzcfkSgfFrG-RSWrS4A.text: I've been eating their Delux burger for years and took several friends there this past Saturday. We all got the Delux burger per my recommendation and what a let down. Complained about the buns and waiter said they recently changed source to Wildflower Bread Company. Absolutely ruined the burger. No one in our group liked it.

hMyA10npp148nJXE7zHPDg.text: On recommendation of my friend who must have gone to Delux a long time ago, the signature burger was served maybe warm at best, with literally cold fries & McDonald's style shredded lettuce.  The burger was undercooked (which was explained to us after we complained about the food temp of all of our meals).  Suggestion to management; instruct wait staff (who in our case was new & not very knowledgeable about menu/bar options, but I don't blame her, except other wait staff not much more knowledgeable) to advise customer of lower cooking rating before customer orders (& before you serve people undercooked beef bacteria!).  Really, if this place was good to great (not sure if back in the late 90's?), then clearly it has been managed into a really second rate burger joint not worth passing a fast food burger restaurant.  Another suggestion to management, maybe take a day & go have a beer and a burger at your competitors like for example Yard House where that many beer handles is worthy a menu that describes your beer ABV & IBU Characteristics with actual bartenders who know their pours!   Until you do figure this out, trust me, your competitors will love your repeat customers!

rjD5t6S84VCYOOxxKbhsFQ.text: This place takes a unique approach to date night. Ever have a girlfriend or boyfriend who can't decide between sushi or a burger? Well guess what! Delux has your back! Delux is often raved as the best place to get a cheeseburger and I can't say they are wrong. Ever heard of Zen 32? Well they moved into Delux and the same sushi can be had here.  They have a large beer selection of at least 40 beer taps. They also have a large cocktail menu and wine menu. The happy hour is generous and lasts from 3pm-7pm.  I purchased the double mini burgers and there was nothing mini about their flavor... DELICIOUS. My girlfriend got the low carb sushi and she said it might be the best sushi in Phoenix, and she is HARAH, when it comes to judging sushi.   We got the Sally cake for dessert and boy was it a great choice. I came for the chocolate but I left talking about the icing. So good and I highly recommend!  Last but not least, the experience is probably the best part about this place. The owner walks around the restaurant and greets everyone and you can tell he loves the restaurant he has built. He is a phenomenal guy and loves to talk to the customers so don't be afraid to say hello.  All in all, a well deserved 5 star review!

UB4bI9I7b2pfz8yKzaK4SQ.text: Such a good burger! I went with the Delux burger and it was very good. Cooked to perfection and seasoned well! The blue cheese was perfect and not overwhelming. Delicate onion flavor that enhances the over burger experience. Our waiter was super attentive and he keep my iced tea filled to the brim! Would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio vibe.
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Close up.
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delux burger lunch special.

DGc6ndKzrX-w3cd7cBRAcg.text: Creative dining concept...sushi, sashimi and real wasabi were all spectacular! The tuna rolls on the daily special were a great deal. Loved the real wasabi!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Family fun

EByBrBRl7n5UEcPMYG3SZw.text: I am obsessed with their milk shake and sweet potato fries, can't forget the outstanding American cheese burger! The BEST!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5UwDlE4T3UbJ7yBFHeCxxA.text: Wonderful fun late night or anytime spot! Best burger around! Sweet potato fries and homemade aioli! Over 40 beers on tap! They also have sushi.   Happy hour is really reasonable especially for sushi.

nl99I5cgFRamFCbq1t8RIQ.text: Really great burgers! We stopped in on a Sunday morning and we were pleasantly surprised. The fries were excellent as well. They serve a variety of other grilled foods, desserts, as well as sushi after 4pm. Might stop back in to give the sushi a try!   The atmosphere is very cool, like a club mixed with a sushi bar, and the staff was nice and friendly.

FBOxGurRDbbJbY4C6psTwQ.text: Super nice and relaxing. Very friendly! I enjoyed myself quite a bit. The food was well cooked and nicely presented. Everything was up too par. Very nice. Would recommend to grab a bite or drink.

JmeyVPEXh321CM-5gJvQVA.text: This place I highly recommend! Burgers or Sushi! And its amazing!

ig5BCridNi3n45I8-mCDsw.text: This is THE BEST place to go for anything!! Classy night with friends? Delux! Relaxed high-end date? Delux!  This is one of a few reviews I do and I'm making this one because ever since I went I just want to go over and over. Their signature "a la cart" fries are si okay amazing, you have to order them if you go! Sushi is definitely a must also not to mention their burgers. Bucket list (or routine) restaurant MUST. service is great too, all servers are happy and helpful.

SxHMjqOfwD8846tXRneKLA.text: This used to be my go to spot when I wanted a good burger. I was there a few weeks ago and it was as I remembered. Today the food was unrecognizable. Stale fries, dried burger, just totally off. So disappointed. The service was great though!

nVtJeHSrOcTAzQ2ooNfN1Q.text: Went late Sunday night and ordered a plethora of food for my first visit.  The Las Vegas roll = highly recommended  The sweet potato fries = great The deluxe chicken salad = a MUST Very good food.

af3iA2nFcsAsvU7H2-VLfA.text: This is my 3rd time ordering on ubereats  and Delux getting my order wrong! I've had complete wrong salads and sandwiches wrong as well as no aioli sauce as I requested 3 or 4!  Not happy with their lack of service for pick up orders!

xhBeoGRGf_hsXJso2N-s5A.text: I have been here three times lately and just don't love it. They really push the all natural Niman Ranch beef thing, but how about making those burgers taste great!?  They basically have two beef burgers to choose from, classic and delux. I had the classic on my previous visit and it was good. Tonight I had the delux and it wasn't so good. Despite the delicious toppings on the delux it really didn't have any flavor. I would rather have a burger full of hormones and chemicals that tastes great!  Be aware that the delux burger is served on a baguette instead of a hamburger bun, some might find this to be a turn off.  Sushi is also available here and it's pretty good. Yes, this is also a sushi restaurant! It's sort of split sushi side/burger side but you can order either or both wherever you are seated.   They have great cocktails, even martinis. French fries are very good and they serve a large portion.   You can't beat the late night hours at Delux! They are open and serve food until 2:00AM. Great concept, the burgers just need to improve a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great martinis!
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes they serve sushi!

jkXS6bFUt2hlXtJnQwvD5g.text: Located in the Biltmore/Arcadia area this has to be one of the best late night options available. Serving a variety of sandwiches and burgers till 2 am. I decided on the Delux burger cooked medium well. Solid quality ingredients, substituted the Bleu Cheese for cheddar on my burger. Had an order of sweet potato fries to go alone with my meal. Everything is a la carte and the fries come separately. Expect to spend about $22 for a burger & fries. Overall a nice upscale burger bar with a stylish ambience!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MWgPMan0dWIKtBnMrZjeng.text: I had been here once before and had a burger with a fun fry "grocery cart" and a beer, which was good, but when one of my attendings brought us back here for sushi, I was incredibly impressed.  Who knew that a burger joint would also have the best sushi in Phoenix?  We chose several of the happy hour rolls, keeping the selections simple (for example, salmon rolls and spicy tuna, without the usual fancy additives).  The rolls contain a large amount of fish and very little rice, really highlighting the flavor of the buttery fish.  Delicious.  We also had some sashimi which was spectacular.  Even better - if you ask for it, the chef will chop up some REAL wasabi.  I didn't even know that the wasabi I ate at other restaurants wasn't real wasabi, but apparently real wasabi looks like a green salsa and has an incredible taste.  Way worth the extra $2.  Try some warm saki while you're at it!  We're excited to bring back friends to what is apparently one of the only places in Phoenix where you can get True unadulterated wasabi without the horseradish.

FvzwfB21wc4wN93kCkmVRg.text: This is one of my FAVE sushi spots to visit and has been for years. I've been loyal to their sushi since they were Zen32. It's not too big so they keep it original with the modern decor and the music they played during dinner this past Saturday night was ON POINT!  The food is ALWAYS spot on. I don't care if you order a burger or sushi- they know what they are doing!! It's fresh, delish, and I've never had to send anything back for any reason at all. The service??? GENUINE & AWESOME!! Laid back vibes but on their grind! The servers take their jobs seriously but also know how to have a nice convo with their regulars, it's refreshing!!   I love the fact that they are open late. It's a super classy spot to have a burger or sushi on a date night or chill night... That kind of versatility makes this place a gem!! Keep it up!!!

WVYNbUCRds4cvHo3Uv_FaQ.text: This is such a great place! Have been several times and don't know why it's taken this long to write a review!  Open until 2 am everyday.... love that!!   Husband had a burger..... I had sushi! All under the same roof!! Genius!!  Service...... fabulous. Tonight we had Tara.... she Rocked!!  Must try this when you just don't know what you want!! It ticks so many boxes   Oh..... did I mention.... 40 beers on Tap! Come on!!

SifGhsHny-JuGPLcGoFB5Q.text: Great late night food!  We have gone here a couple of times when we were looking for a place to eat late at night on the weekends.

k-4rJ4IJRvhPg_fm523ukg.text: It's a really nice place; looks good and is clean. We received a warm reception, had a seat, and proceeded to wait, quite a while. Not a big deal, but it never helps. Then I felt something and realized the vent was dripping on me. I couldn't get away from it; wherever I moved, it splashed me. The food was decent, certainly not bad, but more like a slightly higher priced version of foods that did not elevate beyond other versions that cost less. I work with Niman Ranch products and the sliders were left relatively flavorless as they were overcooked. Also, the sushi was very good, but relatively overpriced as it costs more than a lot of places while being smaller and lacking in presentation. It's not bad, not crazy overpriced, and the service is personable, but slow. Very average experience in a nice environment. The environment would add a half star if I could.

qAxIN4HcrUN4PFqWiUN_mw.text: Best burger & sushi in AZ! They use all natural Niman ranch beef that is truly delicious. Sushi is fresh and delicious.,The sweet potato fries are Ah-mazing & arrive in a cute little shopping cart. The atmosphere is clean, fun & vibrant. Have become a regular because the food & the service is on point. Ask for Tara as she is a fantastic person who also happens to be an excellent server. Even gives us a to go of carrot & beet spiral swirls for our guinea pig. The owner, Lenny, is here in the evenings often and makes a point of making sure your meal & experience is great. Personalized attention & delicious food=must go!  Found another fun & wonderful server in Vanessa. Food amazing as always. Best burger in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SXCmmp_KKUuVXMrlHKwBeQ.text: When I come here, I normally sit at the bar. Also, the bar area/restaurant is not crowded.   Beer list is ok for the area. It is better than some places that advertise themselves as a beer bar.   Bathrooms are not unisex, but normally clean.   Food is pretty good. It's nothing amazing, but a solid burger and sushi roll.  And good happy hour prices if you can come during that time.   If they are broadcasting a game over the speakers and also have it on at the bar, there is a 3-5 second delay between the broadcasts, which isn't pleasant to listen to.   Some bartenders are more attentive than others.  Sometimes my glass is never empty (water or alcohol) and sometimes I have to sit there for a while and flag the bartender down to get more water.

rX0qgQMG_jUQMu1K98JiSg.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had! Fun atmosphere, and a great selection of beers on tap. Anytime I'm in Phoenix I have to make a stop, even if it's a hour out of the way. I always get the classic burger. The bun is amazingly and the beef has wonderful flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9XYG6NyQOSb4eLtONmOjQA.text: Decided to come give this place another try the weekend of Halloween, Douglas, I believe was our server.  He definitely did better as a server than our last few, but that doesn't say too much. He was very patient and attentive for the most part. We ordered 4 burgers a basket of mixed fries and a sushi roll. The sushi roll we ordered was terrible, I had to send it back. Definitely not worth the $16 or so they charge you for it. I can't remember what it's called but, it has a bunch of shrimp in ther, and topped with I believe a spicy mayo?  I've worked at alot of sushi places throughout my life and the size and the amount of shrimp they only give you, definitely isn't worth the money, and pretty bland even dipped in soy sauce with wasabi.  So all in all my experience was good, better service this time.  Burgers are always a 4 star. Sushi is a 1 star. Starting to think we should probably just order burgers to go.

PE-34rtV0KlNqx_lAROzBg.text: Many changes going on at Delux. Lowered prices and fries now included with hamburger. Beer prices will be lowered soon. Better cook as food came out as ordered this time.  Remodeled inside after 20 years ...nice job.  New lunch menu coming with lower prices than dinner. Everything positive here.

kgORVXaRdMKddJ-i5uCJOA.text: The only place in this area that open late  The food is big enough for one person service is nice  The ppl are classy for local  I like the sushi and the burgers  Clean and cool music

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delux burger
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Such a cool thing
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open late for food

OOyGvpbs_qLwy5zWhST4vg.text: AMAZING. We were staying in Phoenix for work and asked the girl at our hotel front desk for a good burger spot. She told us about Delux where we could get burgers AND sushi. I'm preggers and was totally craving a bomb.com burger and that's exactly what I got. The meat was cooked to perfection on a delicious and filling egg bun. Their fries were addicting and come in the cutest little shopping cart, because they are a "cart full of fries." Will definitely come back here next time we are in town, and again when I'm not pregnant and can eat all the raw fishies.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gGH0ibvpxGg6LD_x8ZHXsQ.text: We come here for reverse happy hour once in awhile and tonight just wasn't happy. I think they took the reverse happy seriously because we had crappy service. Eddie, our server, was inattentive and on cold nights like tonight, they should keep that sushi side door locked since the cold air would blow in every time someone mistakenly entered that side. Also the Vegas rolls seem undercooked and I'm not sure how she knows this taste but my sister claims the Vegas rolls tasted like bandaids, I know gross she's tasted bandaids but even more gross she had to relive tasting them by eating those rolls. Overall let's keep the happy in reverse happy hour

MMYRJlRwPAtlZRyvPodamA.text: Holy molyyyyy this place is my jam! First off, I loooveeee sushi. Like, I would marry sushi if I could. But, my boyfriend? Not a fan of raw fish. So we always have an issue when I want to get my sushi fix. Delux is the perfect place for us! It's a sushi and burger bar rolled into one heavenly place.   So, on to the food. I've had all of the low carb rolls, the sashimi, nigiri, and a few of the hand rolls. Verdict? Fresh fresh fresh!!!!!!! And the best part, HAPPY HOUR! They have some great deals!  My boyfriend is obsessed with their hamburgers and fries. Every time I suggest Delux he says HECK YEAH!  Honestly, I am a total sushi snob but this place gets 10 stars. New favorite spot.

YnPDFh5bC3t61SnLMoZ2cg.text: This restaurant is  amazing!  The best Delux Hamburger. The best french fries- the best Chinese chicken salad. Oh you won't believe the amazing vanilla milkshakes. Be still my heart. The childhood memories of what it was is here in the flavor and quality My husband enjoys good Sushi. So this is the place we come. And he always is pleased with quality and quantity! Best in town so he says!   We like the genuine care you receive from where you sit to feeling ; no one is in a hurry to fill your booth and move you out!  The waitresses/ waiters are cream of the crop!  Lennie the owner never fails to pop by and say a few words. What s gem!  I cannot recommend a restaurant more . Great fresh, and always delicious  food consistently!

aHJim30G4pXZ9Y1EBwqE0A.text: We love the turkey burger here! It healthy, juicy and tasty. When you have different craving, you can get sushi or American food. Great options in a small place. They even have real wasabi. Now, they have TVs. They are small but, at least, there is something to watch.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey Burger
Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They finally have TVs.

BHQ9ivLj4uey-DlWUmeZMQ.text: Stopped in for for a quick bite being that what I was really craving was closed for remodeling. Sat at the bar and thinking since it was past the lunch hour it wouldn't be busy (and it wasn't) yet it was a good 4 minutes before I was even greeted.   Ordered a turkey burger, added cheese and mushrooms ($3.50 extra seriously?!?) and got a half order of fries (mixed)  Fries were better plain as sauce was pretty bland.  Burger came with a side of some pico de gallo that had zero taste to it as well as a garlic aioli that a little flavor but nothing to really write home about.  The only thing that was salvaged was the bartender redeemed him self and was pretty attentive after taking so long to get to me.  I gotta say I'm not quite sure I would go back anytime soon. For what I paid I'm just not that impressed.

PLKVtCAc5YovUpbLHtZG3Q.text: I have little else to say about Deluxe, other than it was there that I witnessed the unfortunate result of an unfortunate trend. Low-sodium "soy" sauce got itself added to the table at Japanese restaurants over a decade ago. Like a virus, its process of proliferation led to its overstepping its boundaries. Four years ago, I began having to ask the server to bring the real-er soy sauce to the table, as it became standard practice to bring that green-lidded, watered-down, bitter-tasting, sodium benzoate-laden gorp that people thought would act as the sole prophylactic against future kidney troubles, high blood pressure, and heart problems. My dinner at Deluxe exposed me to the culinary downfall of Western Civilization. The standard procedure, of the server bringing over that swill, happened like clockwork.  - "Will you bring a bottle of regular soy sauce?"  - "We don't carry regular soy sauce. The low-sodium is the only kind we have."  To the server and among my friends, "(chuckling) I never thought I'd see the day..."  What to do...I had to think fast...  - "What if I had a gluten allergy?...Do you have gluten free soy sauce?"  - "Yes we do."  BOOM! Checkmate, Sir. See, like the company informing you that Twizzlers, a product composed almost entirely of sugar, is fat free, I can order gluten free soy sauce and get as close to the real thing as possible. Companies like to save money by cutting their soy sauces with wheat, a practice they may have picked up by watching crafty drug dealers. Those with celiac disease cannot have wheat-derived products, so gluten free soy sauce is typically made purely from soy beans. Kikkoman still looked to money-saving strategies and cut their version with rice, but I was still happier than being forced to dip my maki roll with the fake crab in it into a fake soy sauce.

XxcU1QoMKCy0reb31IHlZA.text: Great service, friendly staff.   The hotdog was amazing. It was supposed to come on a pretzel bun but they brought it on a sesame bun so that was a bummer. It still tasted amazing.   I tasted my sister's Delux Burger, that was a life changing experience. Cooked to order, juicy not greasy.   There were no complaints from the rest of the party about their food (Classic Burger, mahi mahi sandwich).   The regular fries were the perfect crunchiness, as were the sweet potato fries.   It was a little dark, but if nothing to complain about. And if you like bathrooms, this one is neat. Very modern, but more importantly-it's clean.

wsQA2Zt1o9TjXw0VNR4aoQ.text: SETTING: desert/1:30 a.m./Tuesday/the club is not goin' up/I'm disappointed to be awake/alive/hungry.  PLOT: *SPOILER ALERT* I remember Delux is open/I go get a hella juicy Delux burger/plus a wee shopping cart of "how I like my men" mixed fries.  EPILOGUE: Everything was great/I'd totally eat here not at 1:30 a.m./please someone help with this insomnia/never mind I'm just gonna go back to Delux.

mrLtcy65ogPYhkUL-sq4Hw.text: Best burger in the valley if you ask me. The service is sometimes hit or miss, but the food is amazing!   They now have a "To Go" half of the restaurant that has a more casual vibe than the main dining area/bar. They always have nice beer on tap, Ballast Point's Sculpin IPA is there right  meow, need I say more?  Fries - get the mixed basket of sweet potato and regular shoe string.  The creamy dipping sauce (CRanch?) is zingy and addicting - you've been warned! Delux Burger - Nieman Ranch beef definitely fresh, juicy, flavorful and the bread is so soft and perfectly toasted with complimenting sauteed onions.   This place has other yum things on the menu, but if it's your first time go with my recommendation. You won't be sorry.

HNNUUzdD4VJhH1WN9sNCDQ.text: Delux has expanded their menu as well as added sushi to their repertoire. And can I just say, "Holy hell there were a lot of menus that got dropped down on our little two top of a table" lol.   I tried their Samba roll; it was alright, nothing to write home about. The Vegas room was okay - it was a standard Vegas roll. The fries, the one thing I remember being awesome at the place was alright. Maybe I built it up in my mind and it didn't live up to the hype or perhaps it really wasn't super awesome as I once thought it was. The lobster bisque was good. Didn't have that finish that Wild Fish had, but it was still pretty good. I really appreciate that they have local brews available cause who doesn't love Papago's Orange blossom?   Now onto dessert - had a sample of their some pie and their peanut butter cookie which was chewy but not like undercooked or anything. It was a good finish rather than a full dessert. Topped with ice cream was just extra yummy. The apple pie was okay, but you really need the ice cream to combat the top of the pie. The crust under the filling, which has all the yummy flavorful goodness is better and not so dry. Both desserts are a good size and perfectly capable of being split between two people.  I'd come here again and give the sushi more of a chance cause I do love the burgers here.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple pie a la mode!

25eU_Dbt2YyhwjIC1J6bMA.text: I met a friend here for lunch last week after not having been to Delux since it first opened and couldn't believe why it took me so long to come back!  I enjoyed the lunch special of a $12 delux burger with fries - so ridiculously good!  The staff was beyond welcoming and truly makes me want to go back again quickly since they truly appreciate your business.  Nice atmosphere, amazing food and amazing service - what's not to like?

Y_gObkigyfI7ASwbTSJWNg.text: I got to go service and the server I think her name was Alexis went out of her way to make sure our to go order was right and gave us extra condiments plus she was super sweet. Good job and thanks for the great customer service! I will also point out guy at door that is totally creepy that's why I couldn't give 5 stars. If you can get past him You'll get good service and great food. Thanks to the to go server for going the extra mile!!!

OSayy6ipS3Qu-uUszkrexA.text: Came here after reading some of the reviews and unfortunately was disappointed.  Ordered the delux sliders, half order of fries, and a vanilla shake.  Best part of the meal was the fries.  The texture of the burger was off - tasted almost rubbery and had vey little seasoning.  The shake too watery and didn't have much flavor.  Would rather get this combo at In N Out and save 10 dollars.

Yu5jmvG5QSIlHiu0MglKzA.text: The burger is juicy and yummy. My friend and I ordered the same thing and we enjoyed the burger immensely. The patty simply melts in your mouth. Also ordered the mixed fries. The only complaint is the food was pretty rich and I felt kinda nauseous after devouring the burger and inhaling the fries. It's my problem though. Give it a shot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_5PtmSPDSIFQo-jXQY9Cpg.text: Two words: "Yasss Queen!" This place is delicious, quick, amazing and friendly!!! Alisha was our server and she provided one of my best resteraunt experiences in Phoenix!!!

44jUlsDVRFeWNOKrSIxudw.text: Best burger in Phoenix. I don't get there often, but when I'm near the Biltmore area, I always make it a point to stop in. Order the DLuxe burger. Why mess around? It's perfect. Just get it as-is, medium rare. Then get yourself a shopping cart of sweet potato fries and dip them in the fry sauce. Do it! You won't regret it.   What else? The beer selection is amazing. And the service...the service. I can't even describe how friendly and accommodating they were today at lunch. I put my white cloth napkin across my black pants and the waitress asked if I would prefer a black napkin instead so I could match. What? That's insane attention to detail.   I've been going for 10 years. I took my wife-to-be there on one of our first dates. I take clients there. I had my bachelor party meet there for dinner before we hit the nudie bar. It's versatile like that. I'll always come back.

zox8g82XMbTaLscGRE4emw.text: I don't know where to start. Walk in at 2 pm on Sunday. 6 people are there counting us. Place our orders and I ask for a root beer float. $7.95. After a few minutes I'm told they have to purchase root beer next door. After 15 minutes our food comes out, waitress still busy shopping for root beer next door at Safeway. They usually have root beer on draught; something that sort of justifies $8 for the float. Another 10 minuets go by and we've just about finished our food and a root beer over ice in a cup comes to the table. I tell the server I ordered a root beer float and she apologizes and has it made. Ready to pay my bill, and holding a fresh can of "A&W from Safeway"$8.00 root beer float would have been ok if the burger was good, which it wasn't. The burger was ok at best And to top it all off I was charged for a root beer and a root beer float. Worst experience I've had going out to eat in a very long time.

bzivG3-hIBlNLz2ASEQb-Q.text: Delux is delicious! I go here pretty often and it has yet to disappoint me! You wouldn't expect to find amazing burgers and amazing sushi in the same place, but they manage to do it every time! The fries are great too and come in a cute little shopping cart :) I loveee the fact that they're open until 2AM because it helps when I'm out with friends and we are hungry but most places are closed.   The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the food can sometimes take a while to come out, but hey for the food you're getting, I don't mind waiting a little while! :)  I will continue to recommend Delux to anyone in the area looking for good food!!

BzI5lvxvZRGnhgsgaLbKnw.text: Love this place.  This review is long overdue.  My girlfriend and I hit this place up late one night when we were craving food.  We know it was a burger place but had heard it had good sushi also, so we decided to give it a shot.  This was an excellent idea.    We got there and were seated in the sushi side as that was what we were craving.  Tara was our server and she was awesome.  She made some great recommendations based on what we liked.  We ordered a few rolls and had a couple of drinks.  Here is some info on the rolls we shared:  Lollipop roll - good, light, looks like a lollipop  Samba - excellent and tasty, little bit of heat on the back end - teriyaki-ish  Vegas roll - very good, lightly fried but great flavor  Overall, it was a great experience and we will definitely be back next time we are in the area.

2QJrjTLwxWGzX70045pZ0Q.text: As a professional musician, I'm used to hunting for places to eat after 1am, which in the early-to-bed, early-to-rise culture of Phoenix is not easy unless you're willing to settle for the typical Denny's or IHOP.   Delux is a go-to spot when I can get there before they close at 2am.  And, unlike virtually any other establishment open at that time, it's not a compromise or last resort.   Food: Everything I've had--from soup to burgers, appetizers, etc. has been top notch and very delicious and properly prepared.  The burgers are obtained exclusively from one ranch and you can definitely tell the difference in quality.   Good selection of craft beers if you're into that.   Service: I've been here many times and always had excellent, friendly service.  I see some others' complaints here, but I've never personally received poor service.  The opposite is True--I've walked in more than once within minutes of closing, and not once has the staff acted in any way annoyed nor hurried me.  That is HUGE in my book.   On occasion the owner is there and he's very friendly and personable.   Atmosphere: It's trendy and upscale, but small.  I like sitting in a booth, and none exist here, but that's a relatively minor issue.  There is a nice patio out front which is comfortable for most of the year (they have lots of space heaters).    All in all, one of the best burgers in Phoenix along with other great fare.  And probably the best choice for late night dining.

Xket80CKZq1PFg5gPwgO4g.text: Come on down for the best late night happy hour! 40+ craft beers. Burgers are out of this world. Then there are the fries. Wow.

VnIhac17S6FCnYjwhasH5g.text: Delux.  Since today was National Cheeseburger Day I thought it only right to go out and find a place where I can get a really good cheeseburger, and from all of the reviews, this sounded like the place. We started out with their take on Bruschetta for an appetizer, which while good, lacked a bit of flavor. The bread was a little too soft for my liking and they piled the mixture on so high that you had to lift your plate to your face just so it wouldn't fall all over the table when you took a bite. So for the main course, we obviously both got the classic cheeseburger and a half order of fries. The ingredients came on the side and the fries on a completely different plate. The array and design of the dishes and food looked wonderful. As we ate our cheeseburgers we both noticed that the burger had no flavor, like it hadn't been seasoned at all. Honestly, they could have just put some salt on it before the cooked it and it would have been perfect but it was lacking on that department. Other than that the burger and the ingredients (pickles,onion,tomatoes, and lettuce) were very fresh and tasty. The bun was the best part, cooked with perfection to a golden brown outside yet a perfect medium between crispy and soft. Very tasty! The fries came with this garlic Chipotle aoli sauce that was to die for! I was well satisfied with the meal. For dessert, we ordered the Classic Root beer float made with two scoops of Haagen-Dazs vanilla ice cream- and you can't really mess up a root beer float, so that was a perfect ender to an overall, pretty good lunch.  And to comment on the service, it was great. She came only a couple times when she needed to and not any more so we can enjoy our lunch. I give this jazzy joint a 4 out of 5 stars. And recommend you try it out for yourselves!

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Classic Cheeseburger well done with Cheddar cheese

WqRilcXdEMDA11NhxZzIDg.text: This place has the best burgers and sushi I've ever tasted!!!!! And the staff is VERY friendly! Especially our server James& the other girl whose name I forgot to spell but starts with a L. They're awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Delux - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rainbow roll

GMhu5ggbpMqtf0PEI--owQ.text: Great place to come and enjoy a well cooked burger some delicious fries and an ice cold beer from their wide selection of beers and other beverages they offer! They also have a killer sushi menu that's very well crafted and is delicious!

5rTOuKVrk7YbTuyZEXum9Q.text: You are pretty much guaranteed a good burger at Delux.  That plus a hugeormous selection of beer and amazing service equals a great meal.  About the service, the last time I was there my waitress had a knack for knowing what I wanted before even I did.  That was impressive.  If I needed my drink topped off she was already on it.   Word to the wise, chances are you'll be sitting at a big long table with a bunch of other people.  So if you are looking for something more intimate, this isn't your place.

CsRwiuTPQUhU0OtLWx391g.text: I got the lucky opportunity to tag along with the wife at her business lunch today.  Her boss, a lovely man named Jim, chose Delux, and what a pleasant surprise.  I ordered the cool Fresh Panini with fresh mozzerella cheese, fragrant basil and ripe tomatoes.  MMM, so good, dipped into a mix of balsamic and olive oil.  Morgan shared her burger with me, grassfed beef, and very juicy and delicious... I think it was topped with gorganzola?  So clean tasting... on very good brioche buns.  We also ordered a milk shake "that's a pretty fuckin good milk shake!"... chocolate goodness!
